content:
This 1-day digital marketing essentials course will equip trainees with the essential foundations of digital marketing. Through real world case studies, trainees will gain an understanding of the features and use cases of various digital marketing channels and learn how each of them can be integrated into their businesses.

Trainees will also be exposed to digital marketing analytics, and be introduced to Google Analytics. Through an understanding of the platform, trainees will be able to evaluate the performance of their digital marketing efforts.

Furthermore, trainees will also be given access to a toolkit of templates, checklists, and guides to assist in their learning process. The toolkit of resources can be used to reinforce what they have learnt in the course, and it may also be used as an actionable toolkit to help shape their own digital marketing campaigns.

By the end of the day, trainees will take away an actionable essential digital marketing plan and be able to apply the concepts learnt to their real world projects.
objective:
Learning Outcomes:
LO1: Plan digital marketing objectives and resources to execute digital marketing campaigns
LO2: Design digital marketing funnels comprising of a mix of digital channels
LO3: Develop individual digital marketing channel strategies based on research on consumer needs and preferences
LO4: Document essential digital marketing metrics to monitor performance of digital marketing campaigns
title: WSQ Digital Marketing Essentials (Synchronous E-Learning)

●	develop digital advertising media planning strategies to select media vehicles that meet creative, reach and frequency, legal and ethical requirements of the advertising messages relevant to the target audience profiles within agreed timelines and budgets 
●	evaluate costs and effectiveness across integrated digital advertising channels to a brand’s target markets or audiences based on pre-defined KPIs
●	develop a digital advertising campaign optimisation schedule as part of managing ad operations in-house or outsourced
●	negotiate with digital media owners or digital agencies on rates, deliverables, and timelines

objective: The Advanced Digital Advertising course is designed for individuals who are already familiar with the fundamentals of digital marketing and wish to specialise in digital advertising. The course covers the digital advertising landscape for a brand, including an in-depth understanding of the different advertising channels available, such as search engine advertising, social media advertising, programmatic advertising, and video advertising. Trainees will learn how to create effective advertising campaigns that align with a brand's objectives and target audience. The course also focuses on advanced digital advertising strategies whereby the trainees will gain hands-on experience in creating and executing advanced digital advertising strategies across multiple channels. Besides, the trainees will also learn how to evaluate digital advertising campaign performance and manage digital advertising operations.

content:
With the rapid rise of digital technologies, the world is more interconnected than ever as interactions in the digital realm continues to grow in both size and span. For businesses, the digital domain presents a whole new world of opportunities with its enormous customer reach and the pathway for businesses to demonstrate their value and favorably shape customers’ experiences. For any business to fully exploit its commercial potential in the digital space, effective digital marketing is vital. 

The programme is specially curated to provide learners with a strong understanding of the changing fundamentals of marketing necessary to be successful in the thriving digital space, and equips them with the practical knowledge and skill sets to strategize, plan and execute effective digital marketing campaigns utilizing a suite of market-ready and market-proven digital marketing tools.
objective:
This is a 6-month course designed by experienced industrial practitioners to cover the key aspects of Digital Marketing that will enable trainees to excel as a Digital Marketer in today's digital business landscape.

Through project works, trainees will build up valuable hands-on experience in strategizing and optimizing digital platforms, interpreting critical marketing analytics, and orchestrating effective search engine campaigns with the use of the right marketing tools to get their Digital Marketing career off to a flying start!

Key objectives include understanding the impact of AI and its applications, gaining an in-depth grasp of digital marketing's core components and operational models, and conducting a comprehensive digital marketing audit with a strong focus on market and competitor analysis, bolstered by the integration of online platforms and AI tools. Additionally, the course emphasizes formulating digital marketing strategy with specific action plans, budget allocation with a view of ROI. Learners will acquire essential digital analytics skills, enabling them to navigate the dynamic and ever-evolving digital marketing landscape.
title: Integrating AI into Digital Marketing Strategy

content:
This 2-day interactive digital marketing strategy course is packed with real world case studies, industry best practices, and proven methodologies on how to develop an effective digital marketing strategy for both B2B and B2C businesses.

Participants will gain broad insight on the most current digital marketing strategies, frameworks, and methodologies practiced by digital marketing industry experts.

A range of instructional design methodologies (e.g. Brainstorming & group discussion, case study & problem-solving, concept formation, role-play), integrated with a mix of interactive quizzes and presentation will be used to facilitate and engage the learning experience.

Packaged into bite-sized modules, this compact 2-day workshop will provide participants with a comprehensive overview on how corporate companies, SMEs, and industry experts develop and execute tactical and sustainable digital marketing strategies and campaigns.
objective:
By the end of the course, learners will be able to:

LO1: Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of the concept of digital marketing, features of various digital marketing channels, and where digital marketing fits in the business strategy
LO2: Define digital marketing KPIs and derive metrics based on the marketing objectives
LO3: Perform market analysis (competitive analysis, emerging consumer trends) and customer research using digital tools and strategic frameworks
LO4: Develop a strategic digital marketing plan by combining appropriate digital marketing and traditional marketing channels to boost brand awareness, customer engagement, and sales
LO5: Set up and implement digital marketing campaigns such as creating media plans and implementing Google Analytics and campaign tracking
LO6: Interpret and evaluate digital analytics reports and apply a continuous optimization process to improve business performance

content:
Digital transformation is an agenda item that leaders cannot ignore or delay. You either “eat it” or “be eaten”. However, digital transformation is not easy to pull off as 84% of organisations fail in their digital transformation efforts 
Too many organisations approach digital transformation as only a technology transformation when it is much more than that. First, there has to be alignment to the overall corporate strategy. Second, success factors such as culture, people, process, data and analytics, and technology have to be tightly integrated. Third, a collaborative and reverse leadership style is essential to not only lead digital transformation but also, to manage resistance to change.
objective: Drawing on real life practical experience and research that uncovers the fundamentals of digital transformation across enterprises and small medium businesses, “Success Factors for Leading Digital Transformation” gives you an integrated view, provides you with the knowledge and skills as well as, equips you with a proven approach for leading digital transformation.
title: Success Factors for Leading Digital Transformation

content:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to demonstrate their skills and knowledge to:
•	recognise the latest digital trends and elaborate on marketing technology, automation, and its impact on the organisation’s products or services
•	discuss the concepts of digital strategies from awareness to increasing customer lifetime value 
•	conduct research on market and digital trends and audit of competitor and consumer insights to identify and evaluate potential opportunities and priorities for the organisation’s products or services
•	conduct audit of current digital and technology capabilities, team structure and marketing strategy to evaluate current gaps and opportunities for digital transformation based on the digital marketing maturity model 
•	develop an advanced digital marketing strategy that covers marketing strategies from demand-generation to customer retention and advocacy 
•	map products and services in alignment to the digital marketing strategy to identify touchpoints and priorities
•	create a digital transformation plan and implementation roadmap for alignment of product/service priorities, development of internal/external team capabilities and implementation of the marketing automation and technology stack
objective:
In today's digital marketing landscape, social media platforms have become essential for businesses looking to expand their online reach and engage with their target audience. Facebook and Instagram are two of the most popular social media platforms. This course is designed for digital marketing professionals who want to expand their skills and knowledge of Facebook and Instagram marketing, including how to leverage them to drive business growth and increase brand awareness. It will cover a range of topics related to Facebook and Instagram marketing, such as channels, Meta marketing strategy, and Meta advertising objectives.

Building on foundational digital marketing concepts, the Advanced Digital Marketing Strategy course will focus on advanced strategies for maximising the impact of your digital marketing campaigns. You will work on real-world case studies, developing and executing digital marketing strategies in teams. A collaborative learning approach is adopted to enhance learning by working together to think creatively and critically about how to achieve business objectives through digital marketing and to adapt to changing market conditions, including developing a strategy to grow market demand for key products and services that consider the critical customers, market potential assessment and impact of emerging trends.
title: WSQ Advanced Digital Marketing Strategy

content: In this digital age, businesses are constantly evolving the way in which they measure, plan and implement digital marketing campaigns to keep ahead of the competition and capitalise on opportunities online. Participants will be taught the new digital technologies have fundamentally reshaped marketing practices and brought about changes in the ways that companies engage consumers.
objective: In this course, participants will examine the changing digital marketing landscape, strategize and implement powerful digital marketing campaigns.

content:
The Advanced Certificate in InfoComm Technology (Sales & Marketing - Digital Marketing) aims to equip the trainees with necessary skills and knowledge to plan, implement, and measure successful digital marketing campaigns across a variety of platforms and channels. It consists of five structured and progressive modules:
1.	The Digital Marketing Essentials module has four learning units. It covers Introduction to Digital Marketing, Digital Marketing Funnels, Digital Marketing Strategies, and Digital Marketing Analytics & Optimisation of your marketing, which enable trainees to utilise marketing mix frameworks.

2.	The Digital Advertising module has four learning units that allow trainees to identify and adopt various digital advertising channels to create effective campaigns that meet their marketing goals.

3.	The Social Media Marketing module comprises six learning units that allow the trainees to learn progressively from the fundamentals of social media platforms (e.g., key features of each social network like Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, and YouTube) to the step-by-step process of implementing a social media marketing campaign.

4.	The Search Engine Optimisation module has four learning units that allow trainees to assess and propose suitable marketing channels and platforms to develop a marketing plan.

5.	The Digital Marketing Analytics (Google Analytics) module aims to enhance the trainees’ abilities to develop crucial knowledge and skills to effectively use Google Analytics to measure and analyse the performance of digital marketing campaigns. It has seven learning units that cover different analytics tools and techniques, and trainees will learn how to identify the appropriate tools and techniques to be utilised for different needs, including appraising the business outcomes variables on service and e-commerce websites and forecasting future demand on deployed digital marketing analytic tools.
objective:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should equip with the skills and knowledge to plan, implement, and measure successful digital marketing campaigns across a variety of platforms and channels, including:
●	demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of the principles and practices of digital marketing essentials, including the various types of digital media and their applications in the marketing industry.
●	creating and executing effective digital advertising campaigns using various platforms and techniques to reach targeted audiences and achieve marketing objectives.
●	developing and implementing a successful social media marketing strategy that engages audiences, builds brand awareness, and drives traffic to websites.
●	optimising website content and structure for search engine ranking, using proven techniques and tools for search engine optimisation (SEO).
●	analysing website and campaign data using Google Analytics to gain insights into user behaviour, track performance, and measure return on investment (ROI).

objective:
Discover the transformative power of Generative AI (GenAI) in digital marketing with our comprehensive course. This course empowers participants to effectively review and optimize key performance indicators across various digital marketing channels. You'll learn how to leverage Generative AI tools to elevate marketing campaigns, tailor content for targeted markets, and significantly improve online customer engagement. With a focus on practical applications, you'll gain insights into consumer behavior analysis and develop impactful social media strategies using AI-driven data.

In addition to skill development, the course emphasizes the importance of ethical considerations in digital marketing. You'll explore topics like the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA), addressing the critical need for privacy and data protection in content creation. By understanding the ethical implications and legal frameworks, you'll be equipped to use Generative AI responsibly, ensuring your marketing strategies are not only effective but also compliant and ethical. This course is a must-attend for anyone seeking to stay at the forefront of digital marketing innovation.
title: Digital Marketing with Generative AI (GenAI)

content:
This course is targeted at learners with a WIX website and aims to help them select, evaluate, and optimize a digital marketing mix to promote their WIX website. According to data gathered by HubSpot during this COVID-19 period, COVID-19 has caused website traffic to skyrocket by an average of 12.88% per month whereas in the month of March 2021, it recorded the highest website traffic above benchmark at 34%. This indicates the need for companies to move online. 

However, there are many channels in the digital marketing space such as Search Engines, Social Media, Websites, Email Marketing. Any company moving in blindly into digital marketing will be lost as it will be overwhelmed by the many types and functions of these digital marketing platforms. 

Facebook and YouTube are the two most popular platforms; however, an organization should not move blindly into using these two platforms as it requires tremendous efforts to maintain the content. Instead, an organization, should evaluate their internal capability, their products and services before selecting the ideal digital marketing platform.

In short, this course aims to equip the learners with the knowledge and skills to approach digital marketing, by analysing and selecting the available digital marketing platforms, evaluating the performance of this selection and re-aligning the digital marketing mix.
objective:
This module will address performance gaps/needs including:
Gap 1: Learners have little or no experience in analyzing an organization’s digital marketing mix
Gap 2: Learners have little or no experience in measuring the performance of the selected digital marketing mix
Gap 3: Learners have little or no experience in re-aligning an organization’s digital marketing mix based on marketing performance
title: WIX Marketing and Automation

content:
The rapid pace of change in the retail sector has had a profound impact on businesses worldwide. While the demand for physical stores, where businesses can directly engage with customers, remains relevant, it is essential not to underestimate the growth and emerging norms of digital commerce. 

The upheaval brought about by the Covid-19 pandemic has significantly accelerated the adoption of digital commerce, reshaping consumer shopping behaviours and how businesses interact with their customers. It is imperative for businesses to acknowledge these evolving shopping norms and consider how best to integrate these changes into their business models.

This course offers learners insights into the latest digital trends, technologies, and tools that the retail industry has embraced to connect with and cater to the preferences of new-digital shoppers. Participants will gain valuable knowledge on how to leverage these technologies to propel business growth.
objective:
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:
- Understand the changes to consumers post pandemic
- Identify new ways to engage customers
- Appreciate new digital engagement tools
- Recognise how retail trends impact the industry
- Understand cybersecurity and cyber threats

content:
Industry 4.0 creates a disruption and requires companies to rethink the way they design their supply chain. Several technologies have emerged that are altering traditional ways of working. On top of this, mega trends and customer expectations change the game. Besides the need to adapt, supply chains also have the opportunity to reach the next horizon of operational effectiveness, to leverage emerging digital supply chain business models, and to transform the company into a digital supply chain. Comprising 5 modules, this certificate programme is designed to equip participants with the knowledge and skillsets for conducting systems modelling, simulation, and managing the digital supply chain integration projects.

Module 1 provides participants with a broad overview of ongoing alignment of technology adoption across various sectors of supply chain and logistics such as maritime supply chain, air and sea freight operations, warehousing and logistics operations, transportation and distribution, and supply chain operations management.
objective:

• Develop an understanding of the impact of digitalisation strategy that embeds the latest technologies
• Evaluate the various tech developments impacting different sectors of supply chain
• Identify the benefits and challenges arising from the adoption of technologies across supply chain operations

content:
This intensive two-day Digital Marketing Analytics training course outlines the features, advantages and benefits of digital marketing analytics. With theory and practical exercises, designed to enhance data planning and capture capabilities, producing actionable insight.

Furthermore, participants will learn how to track and measure the effectiveness of both online marketing channels (SEO, Online ads, Social Media, Content) and offline marketing channels (flyers/brochures, TV, in-store promotions) with Google Analytics, and make important business decisions such as directing your marketing dollars to the best performing channels.

Through intelligent quantitative and qualitative analysis on key user behaviour metrics and deploying industry-leading analytical tools to gain a clear perspective of modern-day consumer buying journeys, Digital Analytics teams will be able to make better business decisions to achieve business objectives.
objective:
LO1: Understand new and emerging trends, techniques, and technologies in digital marketing analytics and market research in the commercial and technical aspects of a modern enterprise website
LO2: Understand the principles of digital marketing analytics
LO3: Define critical questions to be addressed through interpreting digital marketing analytics and market research reports 
LO4: Deploy digital marketing analytics tools to establish and monitor marketing and advertising performance for the measurement of return on investment (ROI)
LO5: Develop new ways to optimise digital marketing analytics data through advanced segmentation and customisation.
LO6: Set up campaign tracking and measuring overall marketing effectiveness such as calculating the marketing return on investment (ROI) through applying appropriate marketing attribution models
LO7: Present Digital Marketing Analytics intelligence insights and make key optimisation recommendations to senior management
title: WSQ Digital Marketing Analytics (Synchronous E-Learning)

content:
This course provides students with a comprehensive introduction to live sound engineering using digital mixing consoles. Centered around the principles and practices of digital mixing, this course equips students with the knowledge and skills necessary to excel in the dynamic field of live sound reinforcement.

Throughout the course, students will gain a thorough understanding of digital mixing for Front-of-House (FOH) and monitoring management. They will explore the functionalities and capabilities of digital mixing consoles, including signal routing, channel processing, effects utilization, and automation. Hands-on training with industry-standard digital consoles will allow students to develop proficiency in operating these advanced audio systems effectively.

Additionally, students will learn the essential techniques and best practices for setting up live sound for small to medium events. They will acquire the expertise to optimize sound reinforcement in different venues and environments, considering factors such as room acoustics, speaker placement, and audience coverage. Emphasis will also be placed on working with wired and wireless audio equipment, ensuring students can handle various audio connections and troubleshoot common issues that may arise during live performances.
objective:
- Develop a comprehensive understanding of digital mixing consoles and their functionalities, including signal routing, channel processing, effects utilization, and automation.

- Gain proficiency in operating digital mixing consoles for both Front-of-House (FOH) and monitoring management, ensuring optimal sound reinforcement during live performances.

- Acquire the necessary skills to set up live sound for small to medium events, considering factors such as venue acoustics, speaker placement, and audience coverage.

- Demonstrate the ability to work with wired and wireless audio equipment, including audio connections, troubleshooting techniques, and system optimization.
title: Digital Live Sound Engineering
trainingProviderAlias: ORITA SINCLAIR SCHOOL OF DESIGN AND MUSIC PTE. LTD.

content: The Capstone Project (Digital Marketing Campaign) module is designed to provide trainees with hands-on experience in developing, executing, and evaluating digital marketing campaigns. This 2-day hands-on Digital Content Creation Course is designed to equip trainees with the knowledge, skills, and strategies necessary to excel in the ever-evolving realm of digital content creation. Delve into the art and science of creating engaging and impactful digital content across various platforms.

This course provides trainees with the foundation for effectively organising, curating and delivering content. Trainees will learn how to select and implement content management systems that optimise workflow efficiency and ensure the delivery of relevant and compelling content.

Building upon this, trainees will dive into visual asset creation. Learn how to apply brand guidelines effectively while developing visually stunning and cohesive visual assets. This course will include hands-on projects using online tools and resources to create content, including graphics, animation, GIFs, videos and more.

Trainees will be able to explore design principles and industry best practices to bring the creative visual to fruition while ensuring it is engaging and compelling for audiences.
objective:
By the end of the class, trainees will be able to:
• Select and implement effective content management strategies and guidelines to ensure the organisation, accessibility, and relevance of digital content.
• Evaluate the types of available visual assets and content management systems and adopt appropriate management systems.
• Determine the suitability of content based on brand objectives and apply brand guidelines effectively while creating visual assets.
• Utilise online content creation tools and resources to produce graphic layouts for digital platforms, basic animations and GIFs, and videos and audio-related content while adhering to design principles and best practices.
• Craft accompanying copy for created and curated content, as well as leverage AI tools.
• Evaluate the effectiveness and impact of digital content and assess the capabilities of content management systems to make informed decisions for content optimisation and continuous improvement.

content:
The curriculum focuses on advanced cloud architecture and digital solutions. It covers the essentials of designing cloud-based IT infrastructure, aiming to enhance the ability to optimize and integrate cloud services effectively. Participants will gain the technical skills needed for architecting cloud solutions and preparing for certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate.

Additionally, the curriculum explores a range of digital technologies, including networking, Internet of Things (IoT), Machine-to-Machine (M2M) communications, cloud computing services, digital security management, and video analytics. Emphasis is placed on how these technologies converge to create comprehensive digital solutions for Industry 4.0 applications, including government and industry initiatives like Singapore’s Smart Nation. Participants will acquire knowledge to design, implement, and manage advanced digital solutions tailored to modern industry needs.
objective:
The Specialist Diploma in Cloud Computing (Architecture) (NSCCA) focuses on cloud architecture and practical application across emerging technology areas, supporting end-to-end digital transformation. It equips participants with the knowledge and skills required to undertake new roles that include SysOps Engineer and Solutions Architect in the Information Communication Technology (ICT) industries.  

The knowledge and application covered in NSCCA are:
•	Cloud Concepts and Core Services:
o	Overview of cloud concepts, including security, architecture, pricing, and support.
o	Technical skills for building cloud-based projects aligned with industry requirements.
•	Enterprise Linux Operating Systems:
o	Developing the skills to effectively administer enterprise Linux systems.
o	Mastering basic Linux system administration tasks, including hardware management, user administration, file systems, and troubleshooting.
o	Understanding SELinux, firewall configuration, and network attachment.
•	Intermediate-Level Architecting for Cloud Infrastructure:
o	Fundamentals of building cloud-based IT infrastructure.
o	Optimizing cloud usage by understanding cloud services and their fit within solutions.
o	Equipping participants with technical skills for architecting cloud-based solutions.
•	Digital Technologies for Industry 4.0:
o	Covers networking, Internet of Things (IoT), Machine-to-Machine (M2M) communications, cloud computing services, and digital security management.
o	Focuses on how these technologies integrate to create complete digital solutions.
o	Includes real-world application use cases, including Singapore’s Smart Nation and Industry 4.0 initiatives.
title: Certificate in Architecting & Solutioning on Cloud

content:
This 2-day training will be conducted via interactive lectures with various group discussions and hands-on activities. Learning will be assessed via a Case Study and Written assessment.

For Unit 1, learners will be introduced to the foundations of marketing strategy and the range of digital marketing channels and platforms available. They will learn how to leverage generative AI to effectively assess the advantages and disadvantages of key channels and select the optimal mix aligned with business goals and target audience. 

For Unit 2, learners will build on the channel knowledge introduced in Unit 1, focussing on utilising generative AI such as ChatGPT to develop integrated digital marketing plans across channels that engage customers. They will learn how to create comprehensive plans tailored to your strategy and audience personas using AI-generated insights.

For Unit 3, learners will cover creating engaging, strategic content across digital channels using generative AI and best practices. They will learn how to leverage AI to efficiently produce quality content optimized for your brand and audience across formats, channels and campaigns.

For Unit 4, learners will cover how to successfully implement integrated digital marketing campaigns across tactics using generative AI. This involves effectively combining elements like content, advertising and email marketing into cohesive campaigns.

For Unit 5, learners will focus on using generative AI to analyse campaign data across channels and optimize performance. They will learn how to leverage AI-generated insights to continuously improve marketing effectiveness based on key success factors. This will allow learners to close the loop on the marketing activities covered in Units 1 to 4 and let them estimate how well (or not) their marketing campaigns have been performing for the business so that they can take targeted steps to improve the results.
objective:
The learning units are designed to progress in a logical sequencing using part-to-whole packaging to bring learners through the foundational knowledge and abilities to develop cohesive skills in integrated marketing in this order:

LO1: Differentiate and select optimal marketing channels and strategies aligned to business goals and target audience with generative AI

LO2: Develop integrated digital marketing plans across channels to engage target customers with generative AI

LO3: Create engaging content across digital channels using generative AI and best practices for messaging, formats and timing.

LO4: Implement integrated digital marketing campaigns using tactics and elements aligned to goals with generative AI.

LO5: Analyse and optimise campaign performance across channels based on key success factors with generative AI.

In addition, an introduction to generative AI will be delivered together with relevant case studies with hands-on activities, to further enrich learner’s understanding of and application of AI in marketing.
title: Integrated Digital Marketing with Generative AI

content:
NSBML and NSBM courses were conceived in 2018 in line with the aspirations of Building and Construction Authority’s (BCA) BuildSG initiative to encapsulate digital transformation of the Built Environment (BE) sector. Both courses were designed to respond to BCA’s Construction Industry Transformation Map (ITM), of which Integrated Digital Delivery (IDD) is one of the key thrusts under the initiative to transform the AEC (Architecture, Engineering & Construction) industry sector to one that is BIM proficient and ready. IDD builds on the use of BIM and Virtual Design and Construction (VDC) to drive the needs of the BE industry from design to construction to asset management stages, covering four main areas:

a.	Digital Design - To achieve design objectives through coordinated design to meet client’s, regulatory and downstream construction requirements.
b.	Digital Construction - To achieve delivery, installation and monitoring of on-site construction activities to maximise productivity and minimise rework.
c.	Digital Asset Delivery and Management - To achieve real-time monitoring of operations and maintenance to enhance asset values.
d.	Digital Fabrication - To achieve translation of design to standardised components for automating off-site production.

The core curriculum structure and framework of both NSBM and NSBML courses are based mainly on the above IDD objectives in Digital Design and Digital Construction.

The core curriculum covers the following six (6) Modules:

•	Module BE0401: BIM Fundamentals
•	Module BE0402: BIM Standards & Implementation Strategies
•	Module BE0403: BIM for Design Coordination & Documentation
•	Module BE0404: BIM for Quality Assurance Checking, Design & Quantity Surveying Analysis
•	Module BE0405: BIM for Construction Planning & Coordination
•	Module BE0406: BIM Project
objective:
The Course Objective of the two (2) courses, NSBM and NSBML, remain unchanged as per the approved Course Proposal in 2018 . The Course Objectives for students taking the two (2) courses, as extracted from the original approved 2018 Course Proposal, are:
•	To develop strategic skills for BIM project planning and implementation
•	To look forward to career advancement and Job Role opportunities as a BIM Specialist, Coordinator or Manager
•	To become the organisations’ BIM Strategist Planner for BIM adoption and BIM Execution Planner to BIM manage building projects during design and construction phases.

The Course Objective of both courses, NSBML & NSBM, are to boost the level of BIM competency skillsets and expertise in the BE industry of Singapore and deepen the BIM management skills and knowledge of the students to enhance their Job Role career progression in the company. 

This is achieved through the institutional-based learning at SP conducted as part-time night classes for the adult learners over three nights per week.

The Course Objectives remain unchanged as they are still relevant to the current and future needs and demands of the BE industry in line with the BCA’s ITM initiatives and IDD aspirations.

The Course Objectives also align with BCA’s Integrated Planning and Design (IPD) initiative which states the following two (2) objectives:

a.	Drive collaborations across value chain to enable better planning from the onset and optimise building design for downstream construction and maintenance.
b.	Create a conducive environment for collaboration and regulatory submissions through common data standards with a data-rich BIM model that is used across the project lifecycle.
 
Reference to link: https://www1.bca.gov.sg/buildsg/built-environment-industry-transformation-map
title: Certificate in BIM Management [Fundamentals, Deployment & Coordination Strategies]

In the digital era, data that is needed to run operations come from various tools and technologies. content: Technology is advancing at an accelerating rate and it can be difficult to keep track in this digital age. In just the last 20 years, the world has seen a fair share of repercussions from this evolution trickling into the finance and banking industries. From crowdfunding to digital currencies, the marriage of technology and traditional finance into a wholly new industry – FinTech – has and will continue to make waves around the world. What are these exciting developments, and what do they spell for traditional financial institutions across the world? This module aims to provide participants with a conceptual framework of the most exciting advancements in the financial industry, and an exploration of its implications and applications.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand Decentralised Finance (DeFi), Digital Currencies and Token Economics in Web 3.0
• Explore the various types of digital currencies and token economics circulating in the market, and evaluate their risks
• Consider the pros and cons of DeFi and explore its potential in organisations
• Identify the efforts being taken by traditional financial institutions to adapt, such as:
   - Application Programming Interface (API) Banking,
   - Open Banking, and
   - Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC)
• Understand the role of RegTech and its applications in Web 3.0
title: Advanced Certificate in Web 3.0 Module 5: Future of FinTech, DeFi and Token Economics

content: Healthcare is a highly regulated industry. There are many Acts regulating drugs, healthcare professionals, medical practices, research and more. What might be acceptable or widely practiced in other industries may not be permissible in health care. As healthcare provision gets increasingly high-tech with the use of wearables, apps, 3D printing, telemedicine, AI/IOT etc, who owns the digital assets and who is responsible for the duty of care?
objective:
At the end of this module, participants will be able to:
• Understand their duties, obligations and liabilities based on both law and ethics.
• Examine/question the kind of data their institutions are collecting, why they need it and if they have a right to collect and use it the way they are using.
• Assess the risks involved in the deployment of digital health solutions.
• Develop a risk management framework to anticipate/transfer/mitigate the risks involved.
title: Graduate Certificate in Digital Health Module 4: Legal Issues & Risk Management

content: This module explores the impact of the Internet, digital and social media, and emerging technological innovations on the marketing of goods and services. It examines consumer response to these innovations and factors that lead to the adoption of these new technologies. In today’s data-rich environment, big data analytics, and information technology have increased the effectiveness of advertising dramatically.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Explain the concept of digital business and its relationship to broader marketing strategies
• Explain the different types of data and approaches to analysis
• Analyse website data and integrate them with market information
• Identify relevant consumer behaviour through website analytics
• Communicate data insights effectively
title: Advanced Certificate in Digital Transformation in Marketing Module 5: Advertising Analytics - How to Measure Success (Synchronous E-learning)

content: The objective of this course is to introduce accountants to the recent trends in digital transformation and financial analytics. Participants will be exposed to the skillsets needed by accountants to remain competitive in the digital era, e.g., programming skills. In particular, this course will focus on the basics of Python programming and the applications of the various packages for data analysis and visualisation, which are important for the day-to-day job of an accountant. In addition, participants will be able to learn how to extract basic financial data from public sources (such as Yahoo Finance and Quandl) and how these data can be used to plot graphs, charts, and regression analysis to make more informative decisions for their firms. Packages such as numpy, Pandas, matplotlib, and statsmodels will be used as application tools.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to: 
• Understand the concept of digital transformation and learn how to use business model canvas to recommend digital transformation practices for firms
• Review the basic statistical concepts and apply them to financial setting
• Learn basic Python programming 
• Perform relevant financial analytics and generate inferences based on the analysis
title: Financial Analytics with Python

content:
NSBML and NSBM courses were conceived in 2018 in line with the aspirations of Building and Construction Authority’s (BCA) BuildSG initiative to encapsulate digital transformation of the Built Environment (BE) sector. Both courses were designed to respond to BCA’s Construction Industry Transformation Map (ITM), of which Integrated Digital Delivery (IDD) is one of the key thrusts under the initiative to transform the AEC (Architecture, Engineering & Construction) industry sector to one that is BIM proficient and ready. IDD builds on the use of BIM and Virtual Design and Construction (VDC) to drive the needs of the BE industry from design to construction to asset management stages, covering four main areas:

a. Digital Design - To achieve design objectives through coordinated design to meet client’s, regulatory and downstream construction requirements.
b. Digital Construction - To achieve delivery, installation and monitoring of on-site construction activities to maximise productivity and minimise rework.
c. Digital Asset Delivery and Management - To achieve real-time monitoring of operations and maintenance to enhance asset values.
d. Digital Fabrication - To achieve translation of design to standardised components for automating off-site production.

The core curriculum structure and framework of both NSBM and NSBML courses are based mainly on the above IDD objectives in Digital Design and Digital Construction.

The core curriculum covers the following six (6) Modules:

• Module BE0401: BIM Fundamentals
• Module BE0402: BIM Standards & Implementation Strategies
• Module BE0403: BIM for Design Coordination & Documentation
• Module BE0404: BIM for Quality Assurance Checking, Design & Quantity Surveying Analysis
• Module BE0405: BIM for Construction Planning & Coordination
• Module BE0406: BIM Project
objective:
The Course Objective of the two (2) courses, NSBM and NSBML, remain unchanged as per the approved Course Proposal in 2018 . The Course Objectives for students taking the two (2) courses, as extracted from the original approved 2018 Course Proposal, are:
• To develop strategic skills for BIM project planning and implementation
• To look forward to career advancement and Job Role opportunities as a BIM Specialist, Coordinator or Manager
• To become the organisations’ BIM Strategist Planner for BIM adoption and BIM Execution Planner to BIM manage building projects during design and construction phases.

The Course Objective of both courses, NSBML & NSBM, are to boost the level of BIM competency skillsets and expertise in the BE industry of Singapore and deepen the BIM management skills and knowledge of the students to enhance their Job Role career progression in the company.

This is achieved through the institutional-based learning at SP conducted as part-time night classes for the adult learners over three nights per week.

The Course Objectives remain unchanged as they are still relevant to the current and future needs and demands of the BE industry in line with the BCA’s ITM initiatives and IDD aspirations.

The Course Objectives also align with BCA’s Integrated Planning and Design (IPD) initiative which states the following two (2) objectives:

a. Drive collaborations across value chain to enable better planning from the onset and optimise building design for downstream construction and maintenance.
b. Create a conducive environment for collaboration and regulatory submissions through common data standards with a data-rich BIM model that is used across the project lifecycle.
 
Reference to link: https://www1.bca.gov.sg/buildsg/built-environment-industry-transformation-map
title: Certificate in BIM Management [QA, QS & Construction Coordination]

content: This 2 day hands-on Workshop Photoshop Training will help participants getting started and mastering the tasks of creating and editing digital pictures.

content:
The digital age is characterised by a strong need for agility, focus on customer centricity and design highly innovative products, services and processes. Yet much of the world still operates on fundamental patterns of thinking that are largely a byproduct of the Industrial Age which is an inhibitor to meeting the new demands and realities of the economy.  

To be prepared for the future of work, a recent 2020 publication by the World Economic Forum (WEF) highlighted the top ten essential skills in order for us to be relevant, successful and integral as part of the global workforce. Interestingly, the focus now has shifted to the emphasis on soft skills and the ability to translate these mindsets and skillsets to enable individuals to become more entrepreneurial, innovative, critical thinkers and problem solvers. Going beyond tools and frameworks, participants will learn essential core thinking traits through agile methodology, lean thinking, design thinking as well as other future oriented management and innovation approaches.
objective:
At the end of the 2 day course, participants will be able to:
• Understand at a fundamental level the new thinking modes that we should adopt to keep up and thrive in the new age
• Review and evaluate different orgnisational culture, workplace contexts and practices as they navigate the future of work and digital age
• Recognise the future of work skills based on developing and emerging trends, organisational roles and empahsis on skills 
• Review and analyse essential thinking (mindsets) for the digital age (such as) human centricity, problem solving, entrpreneurial, co-creation and innovation, resilience and growth mindsets
• Translate thinking and growth mindsets into action through individual self assessment, reflection and a personal development plan
title: Essential Thinking : Adopting A Growth Mindset for Critical Thinking and Problem Solving in the Digital Age

content: Innovation is critical for organisational growth, and adding value to the firm and its stakeholders. This module aims to introduce participants to the topic of innovation. It will discuss the intricacies of innovation, and the challenges faced by managers in this area for the purpose of understanding how innovation can be fostered. Active participation in this course will provide participants the opportunity to gain practical, real world experience in the application of related Design Thinking tools and approaches. In addition, this module will help participants to further develop skills in communicating ideas, making recommendations, or delivering solutions. The module encourages participants to think differently, so that they can become active leaders in generating positive change through innovation.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand the importance of connecting with our customers in the digital age
• Learn about digital-first innovation models
• Understand the characteristics of consumer-centric businesses
title: Advanced Certificate in Digital Transformation in Marketing Module 4: Consumer-centric Innovation (Synchronous E-learning)

areaOfTrainings.description: Human Resource Management, Employment and Recruitment

content:
At the end of this course, you’ll be able to: 

 -	Understand the influence of employer branding on attracting and retaining top talent.
 -	Evaluate existing touchpoints to assess competitiveness and improve your employer brand, making it more relatable to your target talent market.
 -	Plan your recruitment approach and develop strategies to optimize quality, cost, and performance.
 -	Detail your social media strategy to ensure alignment between organizational goals, target candidates, content, channels, and metrics.
 -	Create a content calendar and craft topics that engage your target candidates.
 -	Track and analyze digital campaigns and recruitment metrics to recommend improvements based on data insights.
objective:
In the war for talent, your employer brand is more than just your logo; it's the story that defines your organization's identity. Your brand plays a crucial role in attracting qualified candidates. 

Candidates in APAC seek fulfillment and balance when choosing a job. Any employer can say they offer that. You can stand out by showing it. 

Learn how through Strategic Digital Marketing for Employer Branding and Talent Attraction. In this course, you will:

 -	Learn how to effectively use social media, develop content strategies, and create innovative campaigns that showcase your organization's unique identity.
 -	Discover techniques that will help make your brand a magnet to top talent—from collaborating with influencers to using data-driven insights.

Go beyond theory and explore practical strategies that will help your brand stand out and thrive. Take advantage of the insights and tools this course provides, and propel your brand into the digital spotlight.
title: Strategic Digital Marketing for Employer Branding and Talent Attraction (Classroom & Asynchronous)

content:
Upon successful completion of this course, participants will be able to use their mobile devices for daily activities such as searching for information on Google, communicating through Gmail and WhatsApp, as well as conduct online transactions and making e-payments using mobile banking apps.

Participants will also be able to use mobile apps such as SingPass mobile, OneService app, LifeSG etc, to access government digital services. Participants will also be able to stay safe online by using cybersecurity tips such as setting strong passwords and 2FA.

This course is tailored to suit the learning pace of seniors, and step-by-step guides will be provided during the class. 

If you are a Singaporean or Permanent Resident aged 50 years and above, you can enjoy subsidised course fees under the National Silver Academy. For more information on course registration, please contact our Silver Infocomm Junctions.

content:
This Modular Certificate in Secure Network Management (MC4 of Diploma in Infocomm & Digital Media (IT Network & System Administration))-DINSA2  covers the following modules:

• Network Security Essentials - 30 hours
• Network Security Implementation - 30 hours
• Network Management - 30 hours
• Software-Defined Networking - 30 hours
• Secure Network Management Project - 60 hours
objective:
This Modular Certificate in Secure Network Management (MC4 of Diploma in Infocomm & Digital Media (IT Network & System Administration))-DINSA2 aims to train the learners on the following:

1. Introduce various types of vulnerabilities, threats and exploits to implement security measures to mitigate cybersecurity risks to a network environment.

2. Secure IT networks using different threat mitigation strategies. These includes Intrusion Prevention System (IPS), Firewall, Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) management.

3. Manage and troubleshoot enterprise network using various network management tools. Acquire knowledge and skills on network virtualisation and automation.

4. Operate SDN solutions in a virtual networking environment. Acquire knowledge in SDN architecture, abstractions of layers in terms of control and data plane and security consideration.

5. Demonstrate knowledge in network security and management. Setup an enterprise network and implement various network security measures on network devices to mitigate security threats.
title: Modular Certificate in Secure Network Management (part of Diploma in Infocomm & Digital Media (IT Network and System Administration))-DINSA2

content: This Course will be conducted in Chongqing, China, and aims to provide learners with insights into its’ Green, Digital and Care economies. Via these insights and networking opportunities, learners can enable the growth of their organisation in these areas. Learners will be also be exposed to the Chongqing policies in relation to enterprises, import and export polices as well as logistic services. These are enablers for the learner’s to further grow the opportunities that are created.
objective:
On completion of the course, the learners should be able to:
• Understand Chongqing policies in relation to different types of enterprises as well as the pros and cons of each setup. 
• Be acquainted to the policies governing import and export trade as well as supporting logistical services such as bonded warehousing, onestop supply chain management, etc.
• Know about Chongqing policies, regulations and directions of big data management.
• Be kept up-to-date on the latest smart data management application at Chongqing.
• Be acquainted to the developments and management of Chongqing Green District and Care initiatives. 
• Build contacts locally and with their China counterparts to take initiatives on Green, Digital and Care further. 
• Develop competency to manage cultural and business practices at Chongqing
title: Travel and Learn to Chongqing, China: Riding the Waves of Disruption in the Green, Digital and Care Economies

content:
This 2-day module aims to provide aspiring hawkers with fundamental entrepreneurship skills to start up and maintain a hawker business. 

In this class, participants will learn about price setting of their products to maximize revenue and to create their individual unique selling points of their products. These skills would enable them to meet and satisfy the requirements of their potential clientele. Participants would also be introduced to digital marketing on various digital platforms.

 Participants would also be guided through the crafting our their own business plan to combine the ideas they have generated in class.
objective:
At the end of this module, learners will be able to:

- Use basic financial concepts; Revenues, Expenses, Profits & Loss to set prices of food items for revenue maximisation
- Define the Unique Selling Point (USP) of food items
- Identify customers profiles that match various food items so that they will be able modify food taste to local clientele 
- Build loyalty and retain customers for long-term sustainability as well as acquire new customers through both traditional and digital platforms
- Use essential digital Apps for e-Payments and marketing efforts through practical hands-on session
- Explore and find out available government funding schemes for hawkers
- Write a simple Business Plan.
title: Hawker Business Fundamentals

content: This Certificate in Digital Video and Audio equips students with the knowledge and skills required to design , produce, and manage  audio and video content for ‘live’ events which audiences can experience both in-person and virtually. Its modules cover both the creative processes and technical skills required to produce broadcast and ticketed-event quality experiences for audiences. Students acquire knowledge and skills in telling compelling visual stories for a range of event formats. A hands-on curriculum sees students tackling project briefs and generating ideas for audio and multi-camera productions in a studio setting. Students also interpret technical riders, and set up, evaluate, troubleshoot, and operate audio and multi-camera equipment. Students then put to practice the skills required to deliver quality ‘live’ events including for a range of small-scale through to medium-sized Meetings, Incentives, Conferences and Events (MICE) formats, and multi-band performances. Students also develop audio post-production skills for studio work such as recording, and sound design for a variety of media, including podcasts.
objective: As per course description
title: Modular Certificate in Digital Video and Audio Techniques

content:
The assessment helps government agencies in selecting suitable vendors with relevant skilled staff and thus, help ensure that the final products are delivered in good quality. Through this assessment initiative, it will also help incentivise vendors to elevate the overall ICT capability of their staff.

This is to support the Government’s vision to leverage data and harness new technologies, and to drive broader efforts to build a digital economy and digital society, in support of Smart Nation.
objective:
This assessment for Solution Architects is carried out by NUS-ISS and supported by the Government Technology Agency (GovTech) and its Digital Academy.
This assessment is part of GovTech’s assessment programme that is applicable to vendors who intend to participate in relevant government ICT tenders.  These relevant tenders will indicate that interested vendors are required to have their staff assessed so that the vendor can submit the individual staff’s assessment results/certificates as part of their tender submission.

Vendors are required to send their employees to attempt the assessment in preparation for any relevant tender that requires the assessment results. The results/certificate is valid for 3 years and can be used for multiple tender attempts during the validity period.
  
This assessment is also open to individuals and upon successful completion of the assessment, they will be awarded a certificate which is valid for 3 years. They can present a copy of their individual results/certificates to any vendor that they are working for during those 3 years, for the vendor to use in government ICT tenders.
title: ICT Assessment Certification for Solution Architect

The emergence of social media phenomena via LinkedIn has created many opportunities for businesses to reach out across geographical boundaries and industries, providing near-instantaneous communication and updates for PMETs. In this module, participants will learn how to leverage the Conversion Funnel framework to their advantage, fast-tracking the customers' journey from the awareness stage to a level that meets their corporate objectives. 

By discovering the power of LinkedIn in the Conversion Funnel, they can enhance their marketing possibilities and understand how a well-planned digital marketing campaign contributes to the success of their marketing endeavors and decision-making processes.

content: The number of job postings for cyber security professionals has grown from 629 in 2018 Q1 to 4162 in 2021 Q1. This 6.6 times growth in over three (3) years is expected to increase in time, with the government announcing the Safer Cyberspace Masterplan in October 2020 that aims to raise Singapore’s general level of cybersecurity. Under the master plan, a slew of initiatives such as a Cybersecurity Trustmark for enterprises that practise good cybersecurity and newly established processes to boost Singapore’s cybersecurity defence will be put in place to safeguard digital assets.
objective: The course aims to equip our students with the knowledge, skills and competencies to work competently in the area of cyber security, particularly in the area of penetration testing/vulnerabilities assessment and incident response and management.
title: Certificate in Digital Forensics and Cryptography

content:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to demonstrate their skills and knowledge to:
●	apply the principles of digital storytelling to conceptualise and create content ideas that effectively meet marketing objectives, engaging audiences and driving desired actions in the online landscape.
●	create a digital storyboard as an integral component of a content strategy plan, including applying multichannel content strategies that adhere to the parameters of delivering content for marketing purposes, incorporate the essential features of marketing content, and employ various modes of content delivery to achieve marketing objectives.
objective:
We’re living in an era where authenticity and personalised content have a huge impact on how brands are perceived and influence consumer decisions. This holds true for consumers in Singapore, who value genuine connections and respond positively to content that resonates with their preferences and interests.

Our 2-Day WSQ Copywriting and Content Writing course is designed for aspiring writers and anyone looking to master the art of copywriting and content writing. You will be guided on how to use digital storytelling to craft customised content that connects with your audience in a way that feels genuine while achieving your brand’s goals.

This copywriting course covers creating digital storyboards, incorporating SEO in your copywriting, using multi-channel content strategies, ethics and more, ensuring that your content and writing will be impactful and inspire action.

By the end of this content writing training course, you will be equipped to conceptualise and create ideas that resonates with your audience while achieving your marketing objectives.
title: WSQ Copywriting and Content Writing

objective: Many of the digital marketers and traditional marketers are not aware of the tools and jargons of the digital marketing that is required to execute a Social Media Marketing (SMM) campaign. Despite the exponential skills needed in the industry, such skills are not formally taught in any of the local schools. content:
As a term, “transmedia”, basically describes a whole mixed bag of combining production, distribution, and audience engagement techniques in order to give consumers a whole new kind of media experience. The key things driving the development of transmedia in the digital age, are demand and competition! Audiences in today’s digital world expect media to be first and foremost social. They also expect it to be customised for any digital device they’re using, and there should be an aspect of participation involved. Businesses, on the other hand, are competing for customers in the current economic climate. Advertising and marketing can no longer be limited to just a few channels. You need to be available across multiple platforms if you want to stay competitive and relevant. The overall objective of the certificate programnme is to equip participants with the communication tools to work across the various media platforms in the digital age.

This module provides participants with the skillsets to create targeted social media content, using the medium to their best advantage. In today’s world of LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and TikTok – these platforms are not just for the select few but have become mainstream content providers that have the ability to influence, target and reach on a global basis. They’ve also become the tools of choice for journalists, e-commerce platforms and public sector (governments and NGOs) to increase consumer engagement.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: 
• Understand the context, background and workings of social media platforms
• Structure their use of language and create content to target specific audience segments 
• Leverage brand communities and influencer management
title: Graduate Certificate in Media Communication and Strategy Module 2: Social Media Content Creation and Writing

content:
Social media is one of the key aspects of digital marketing, which provide benefits to businesses seeking to connect with customers, increase their brand awareness, and boost their leads and sales. 

While social media marketing tools are extensive and can be very effective, marketers may not necessarily apply the right social media marketing strategies for their businesses.

The WSQ Digital Marketing – Social Media Fundamentals is aimed at helping the target learners develop good foundational knowledge/abilities in various aspects of social media marketing and help translate them into business-related needs/goals such as leads generation and conversion.

The course will also focus on the development of a sound sales plan and social media marketing strategy, based on related market, consumers and product trends, as well as execution of the strategy by setting up posts and ads to be published on social media.
objective:
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:

1. Identify elements of a sales plan and organisation sales cycles

2. Analyse the market, consumers, and product trends

3. Develop a social media sales strategy

4. Publish a social media post or ad with inputs from relevant stakeholders

5. Evaluate and refine the performance of a social media post or ad
title: WSQ Digital Marketing – Social Media Fundamentals

content:
Heuristics are simple rules of thumb we use for decision making. These rules can be pre-conceived from our past experiences, emotions etc. and they help us to make decisions quickly. It has been described as a fast and frugal method managers instinctively turn to when making all sorts of business decisions, as they are often time-starved and do not have the luxury to rely on extensive reports and data for fully informed, calculated decisions all the time.

In this 2-day course, we will examine how heuristics can be successfully applied to improve your sales and marketing effectiveness and to create a leadership position for your product/services, especially in this hyper digital, data overloaded world.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to:
- Appreciate how heuristics affect managerial decision making in a data overloaded, digital environment 
- Assess how heuristics impact sales and marketing effectiveness
- Maximise the effectiveness of heuristics in digital marketing 
- Design effective integrated sales and marketing campaign based on principles of heuristics 
- Achieve Sales and Marketing Leadership in your chosen product/service segment through effective application of heuristics
title: Sales and Marketing Leadership: A Heuristics Approach

content:
Learning Outcome:
- Conceptualize content ideas with prompt engineering to meet marketing objectives and map out digital storyboards as part of a content strategy.
- Identify content requirements with prompt engineering based on evaluation of customers and potential customer preferences and determine frequency of delivering marketing content.
- Determine types and styles of content to be delivered to customers with prompt engineering and decide on modes and processes for distributing content.
- Develop guidelines for content strategy execution using appropriate modes of content delivery for marketing.

Course Outline:
Topic 1: Prompt Engineering Principles and Tactics
•	Introduction to the AI and Prompt Engineering
•	Prompt engineering principles and tactics
•	Conceptualize content ideas to meet marketing objectives using Prompt Engineering 
•	Map out digital storyboards as part of a content strategy 

Topic 2: Market Research Using Prompt Engineering
•	Market research techniques using Prompt Engineering 
•	Identify content requirements based on evaluation of customers and potential customer preferences
•	Determine frequency of delivering marketing content to customers

Topic 3: Content Creation Using Prompt Engineering
•	Techniques for content creation using Prompt Engineering 
•	Process of developing digital storyboard with Prompt Engineering
•	Determine types and styles of content to be delivered to customers

Topic 4: Content Strategy Guidelines and Ethical Considerations of Using ChatGPT
•	Determine modes and processes for distributing content
•	Ethical considerations and guidelines when using AI
•	Develop guidelines for content strategy execution
objective:
This course introduces participants to the dynamic field of Prompt Engineering within the realm of Generative AI Content Creation, focusing on leveraging AI to meet marketing objectives and enhance content strategies. Participants will learn the foundational principles of prompt engineering, including how to conceptualize content ideas, map out digital storyboards, and use AI for market research to identify and cater to customer preferences. This comprehensive approach ensures the development of compelling marketing content that resonates with target audiences.

Further, the course delves into the practical applications of prompt engineering in content creation, guiding participants through the processes of developing digital storyboards and determining the appropriate types and styles of content for different customer segments. With a special emphasis on ethical considerations and strategic guidelines for using AI in content development, attendees will be equipped to effectively implement their learned skills in real-world scenarios, enhancing their content strategy execution with the latest AI technologies.
title: Mastering Prompt Engineering for Generative AI Content Creation

content:
The course provides a platform for aspiring User Experience (UX) designers and User Interface (UI) designers to pick up the essential knowledge and skills to design digital products like mobile applications, websites, digital interfaces, and interactive kiosks.

“The Associate Product Designer is responsible for the design and development of the product line lifecycle, including the end-to-end iterative design process. He/She leads product development in the conceptualisation and design phase, including research performance, job stories creation, journey mapping, content modelling, wire-framing, prototyping, user testing, and high-fidelity visuals generation to achieve design solutions.

a. Note on Associate Product Designer role: In industry terminology, this role can also be defined as more specialised i.e., UX Designer, UI Designer, depending on the size and needs of the company.

The Associate Product Manager manages the product line life cycle from strategic planning to tactical activities, acting as a liaison to support product positioning and customer demand. He/She guides product development from conception to launch, evaluating product functionalities and performance, and proposing enhancements and/or improvements to products based on market feedback. He analyses potential partner relationships for the product, and generates innovative ideas to grow market share, improves customer experience and drive growth.”
objective:
This course aims to prepare graduates for the dynamic workforce in Singapore by equipping them with the necessary knowledge and skills to excel in industry roles that demand technical expertise in product design.

Upon completion of the course, graduates will possess the ability to create exceptional user experiences, conduct valuable user research, drive successful product development, and craft visually appealing and usable UI designs. With this comprehensive skill set, graduates will be well-prepared to contribute to the rapidly evolving field of user experience and thrive in the competitive workforce in Singapore.
title: Certificate in Digital Product Design

content:
This course Digital Enterprise Architecture Framework, provides validation that an individual has the knowledge, comprehension, and ability to analyze and apply the TOGAF Standard to developing, sustaining, and using an Enterprise Architecture. 
This course provides a variety of tools, building blocks and resources that facilitate the process and enables the design of Enterprise Architecture across four domains: Business, Data, Applications and Technology. It offers the means of uniting different methodologies in business planning, IT Architecture, and project management under one common framework.
objective:
To demonstrate mastery of the tasks in this course, the participants must be able to do the following within the given time limit and with the materials, tools and equipment supplied:

LO1	Evaluate the viability of the organisation’s architecture against current and projected market trends and alternative strategies using business strategy formulation and planning principles

LO2	Develop new enterprise architecture metrics-driven strategies that anticipate industry developments, project future trends and meet the vision and priorities of key customers or stakeholders.

LO3	Design a sustainable enterprise architecture development strategy that define architecture metrics to guide monitoring of the enterprise life cycle and incorporate best practices and methodologies.

LO4	Develop an Enterprise Architecture realisation and implementation plan that optimise project cost, value added of new business initiatives and resources management to support business architecture and strategy.

content:
Brands are beginning to realise that rudimentary data analysis isn’t sufficient to paint the full picture of how consumers engage with their brands. Without a holistic understanding of consumer behaviour across multi-channel interaction points, little can be done to improve marketing performance.

This intensive two-day Advanced Digital Marketing Analytics (GAIQ Certification) training course is designed to stretch your comfort level with Google Analytics and guide you through the technical aspects of the platform to extract maximum data insights.

The instructional methods combine a healthy balance of theory with plenty of hands-on exercises, designed to explore advanced analytics concepts such as enhanced data capturing and analysis capabilities that will bring your understanding of digital marketing analytics to the next level.

You will learn, amongst other important concepts, how to track extensive data points across multiple-domains & devices, collect deeper user behaviour insights, set up ecommerce tracking, and customise data specific to a business’s needs with Google Analytics. Through this, you will be able to simplify data analysis and obtain deeper insights to drive important business decisions.

Google Analytics Individual Qualification (GAIQ) Certification

Achieving the Google Analytics Individual Qualification (GAIQ) certification demonstrates competency in basic and advanced Google Analytics concepts. Upon achieving a passing score of at least 80%, you will attain a Google Analytics Individual Qualification certificate, awarded by Google. The certificate is valid for 12 months from the date of passing the exam.

This course covers concepts and topics similar to the GAIQ certification study resources at Google SkillShop, adding on real world case studies and more advanced concepts. Trainees of this course will be entitled to complimentary prep sessions to revise and take the GAIQ assessment after the course.
objective:
By the end of the class, you will be able to:

• Understand in detail how data is collected and measured, and its legal and privacy implications
• Assess strategies and create a comprehensive measurement plan, selecting the most appropriate metrics to measure within analytics for more effective analysis and business outcomes
• Organize a Google Analytics account into a properly structured setup for your business
• Propose appropriate configurations in Google Analytics for specific business requirements
• Develop specific Google Analytics reports based on segmentation and customizations to generate deeper insights
• Analyse Google Analytics data to articulate business implications based on internal and market data analysis
title: WSQ Advanced Digital Marketing Analytics (Google Analytics)

content:
Gartner forecasts Worldwide IT spending to reach USD$4.5 trillion in 2022 while BusinessWire expects the global healthcare market to grow beyond USD$11 billion by 2022. What are the innovative and strategic opportunities available to Singapore based entrepreneurs and business professionals to leap frog Singapore's physical and resource limitations?

The aim of this learning journey is to introduce participants to the vibrant technology scene and innovative solutions in Taiwan that had been used to improve city living, communities,  healthcare, transportation and more.

Taiwan presents a unique case study of an aging population with mature digital health ecosystem that encapsulates the full value chain, including software engineering, hardware design and manufacturing, data analytics and robust healthcare system, which participants from Singapore can draw many parallel and interesting lessons from, to inspire them to adapt and apply in their own job roles.
objective:
At the end of the 7-day programme, participants will be able to:

• Acquire insights into how technologies had been successfully applied to business, healthcare and living in Taiwan, which has close resemblance to Singapore in terms of aging demographics and the management of multiple chronic conditions
• Cultivate important relationships and business networks with the technology/healthcare organisations through visits and meetings.
• Learn from Taiwanese counterparts on their successful adoption of digital technologies and the challenges to overcome.
• Experience first-hand the transformative impact digital solutions/technology have on the society and healthcare provision.
title: Internationalisation Series: Smart Business and Healthcare - Taiwan

objective:

This course introduces an end-to-end operating model for the creation, delivery and continual improvement of technology-enabled products and services. Extensive research has consistently shown that ITIL is fundamental to businesses, enables transformation and helps organizations realise value. Many organisations invest heavily in adopting and adapting ITIL into their business practices and upskilling their workforce with ITIL qualifications.

ITIL 4 will help businesses and industries navigate the new technological era, commonly known as the Fourth Industrial Revolution. The speed of current breakthroughs is disrupting almost every industry on a global scale. 

ITIL 4 provides a practical and flexible basis to support organizations on their journey into the new world of digital transformation by helping them align their human, digital and physical resources, adopt emerging technologies into their IT operations to compete within the complex modern landscape.
title: ITIL4 Foundation Preparation Course

content:
The Fourth Industrial Revolution has begun, spurring a wave of digital transformation that has spread across industries, sectors, and the wider economy. For many working in service-based organisations and “white collar” operations, this trend has led to a focus on the automation of business processes, with new digital technologies such as Robotic Process Automation and Intelligent Assistants increasingly taking root. The resulting impact on work in commercial and government sectors can be radical and disruptive.

In this context, this course will build practical skills in the design and use of the Microsoft Power Platform – an integrated set of low code tools that enable fast development of process automations at the workplace.
objective:
