• Apply an Automation Design Framework
• Create Process Flow Automations using Microsoft Power Automate
• Create Automated Business Apps using Microsoft Power Apps
• Apply an Automation Governance Framework
title: Workplace Automation 101: Automation at Work with Microsoft Power Platform

content:
- Definition of cyber security and its relations to the digital economy and the global connectivity of E-Business, E-Commerce and E-government
- Key cyber security terminologies, types of cyber-attacks / cyber- terrorism and profiles / motivation of cyber-attackers
- Myths and facts about cyber security
- Examples and case studies of past and recent cyber-attacks - lessons learnt
- Cyber security framework, policies, procedures and controls required to counter cyber-attacks and cyber-terrorism
- Cyber security analytics for prediction of cyber-attacks and tracing of attackers 
- Laws relating to cyber security and legal protection against cyber crime 
- Final review and quiz to reinforce cyber security knowledge and
understanding
objective:
This two-day programme aims to define cyber security, explain its risks and challenges in relation to the digital economy and its global connectivity and discuss how the risks could be identified and managed effectively. Examples and case studies of past cyber-attacks will be used to expound on the risks and challenges of cyber security. Ideas and suggestions on appropriate cyber security strategies, policies, standards, guidelines, procedures and controls as well as cyber security analytics for predicting probability of cyber-attacks will be deliberated. Laws concerning cyber security and legal protection against cybercrime will also be highlighted. Practical exercises and discussions will be included.
Specifically, the objective of this programme is to enable participants to be able to:
- Understand cyber security, vulnerabilities, risks and exposures of the firm’s assets arising from the connectivity with the global digital economy of E- business, E-commerce and E-government
- Explain the key terminologies in cyber security, forms of cyber-attacks / cyber- terrorism, profile and motivation of the attackers
- Deliberate examples and case studies of past and recent cyber-attacks and lessons learnt
- Expound key cyber security framework, policies, procedures and controls required to counter the cyber-attacks
- Explore cyber security analytics for predicting cyber-attacks
- Highlight laws on cyber security and legal protection against cybercrime
title: Cyber Security Risk Management for Finance Professionals

- Know how to develop, implement and manage a new content strategy from scratch or improve existing strategy.

content: As the industry evolves, the role of a digital marketer is constantly changing to adapt with the latest tools, strategies, and best practices. With digital marketing now spanning across such a diverse range of core areas, many companies will prioritise candidates who can add the most value to the company. Throughout this current downturn, it’s more important than ever for marketers to understand what core skills they possess, and what additional training they need to become the most employable versions of themselves. The reason why blogging or vlogging is so influential is because it gives a sense of transparency in communication for the consumers. They share information of value that people engage upon. The blog has long been one of the preferred tactics for content marketing strategies. Using a blog, company can easily publish a variety of different content, from written articles to infographics and more. With advancements in technology, the equipment we need to produce a vlog isn’t as expensive to produce quality of video content stands out from the pack, that would be better demonstrated visually.

content: In this module, we take a deeper look into the Chinese technological ecosystem and consumer mindset, along with the unique structure of the Chinese market, to better understand the increasingly diverged digital economy and better position ourselves for the future.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand the modern Chinese consumers: Culture, mindset, trends, and their reliance on social media marketing platforms
• Gain insights into the Chinese social media marketing & sales ecosystem and learn how the customer journey looks like
• Discover the latest in WeChat, China’s super app: Overview, communities, sCRM, ads, payment, mini programs, WeChat Work
• Learn about other essential Chinese platforms: Alibaba, Weibo, Douyin, XiaoHongShu, and more
• Find out what makes a great Chinese marketing campaign: content, placement, formats

content:
Vertical Institute’s User Experience Design Bootcamp is a hands-on programme to equip participants with the most in-demand skills and knowledge in UX/UI design, focusing on financial services applications. Participants will learn how to complete the design process from beginning to end, including conducting user research, to defining a project’s strategy and developing wireframes and prototypes.

You’ll learn current best practices and conventions in UX design and apply them to create effective and compelling digital experiences for FinTech websites or apps. Classes are led by experienced practitioners, culminating with a capstone project at the end that simulates real-world FinTech scenarios.
objective:
-Have a comprehensive understanding of UX design and the design process.
-Understand human-centered user research and the different research methodologies used to obtain data.
-Using principles of information architecture to develop and document personas, journey maps, user flows and annotated wireframes.
-Understand the ins and outs of usability testing to further understand user behaviors and what drives them when using products.
-Identify the best practices in visual and UI design to create user Iiterfaces with these principles.
-Utilize industry-standard tools such as Figma as a UI design and prototyping tool to create wireframes and prototypes.
-Produce UX design documentation as part of a final capstone project, which entails persona creation, wireframing, and working prototypes of a financial digital product.
title: User Experience Design Bootcamp

content: One of the most prominent applications of generative AI in learning is the automation of content creation for digital learning materials. By leveraging generative AI this way, developers can create new content and learning materials, drawing on existing resources such as audio recordings, video clips, images, and simulations. This allows educational institutions, corporate learning and development units and businesses to develop customised learning experiences without manual coding or rapid editing. Ultimately, generative AI can streamline creating and improving digital learning materials, allowing educators to focus on more meaningful tasks such as assessing learning outcomes and providing personalised instruction.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand the basics of Generative AI and how it can be used in learning management 
• Leverage Generative AI in areas such as training materials, curriculum development, assessment
• Personalise Generative AI using different criteria such as different age groups, subject matter, scenarios and case studies
• Understand ethical considerations and responsible use of Generative AI in learning management
title: Advanced Certificate in Generative AI, Ethics and Data Protection Module 5: Application of Generative AI in Learning Management

content: Venture into the dynamic domain of cybersecurity with this encompassing course tailored for those keen on mastering the core aspects of digital protection. The Cybersecurity Essentials course offers a comprehensive journey from foundational concepts to practical applications, providing trainees with the tools and knowledge to navigate the cybersecurity landscape confidently. More importantly, the applied learning approach enables the trainees to acquire a foundational understanding of cybersecurity, including mastery of its principles and best practices, familiarity with essential terminology, recognition of professional roles and responsibilities, and the ability to identify and mitigate prevalent security threats.
objective:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to:
Acquire a comprehensive understanding of cybersecurity fundamentals, its significance in protecting systems and information, grasp key principles including the CIA Triad, recognise essential terminology, and understand the roles and responsibilities of cybersecurity professionals within an organisation.
Demonstrate proficiency in recognising prevalent cybersecurity threats, understand the influence of human factors on security, and apply effective mitigation techniques and measures to safeguard against vulnerabilities and cyberattacks.
Demonstrate ability to apply vulnerability assessment methodologies and tools, implement robust security measures, analyse security logs for anomalies, and recognise the critical role of software maintenance, updates, and patches in sustaining a secure environment.
Acquire proficiency in utilising industry-standard security tools and understand their practical application in cybersecurity operations.
title: Cybersecurity Essentials

content:
This exclusive program, co-developed with Amazon, is designed to help new global e-commerce sellers get started on Amazon.com and understand the ins and outs of selling to the US market. 

Through hands-on activities, discussion and sharing sessions, participants will understand global selling on Amazon.com, including product listing optimization, product sourcing, profit margin and ROI calculation, brand registry and trademarking, and fulfilment options. 

Additionally, participants will learn about best practices for managing their Amazon.com seller account and navigating the rules and policies.

By the end of this programme, learners will have the knowledge and skills needed to successfully sell on Amazon.com and grow their business with direct support from Amazon success team.
objective:
This course provides the knowledge and abilities to:

•	Understand the US market trends and explore global selling on Amazon.com.
•	Identify the legal and regulatory requirements for selling internationally and ensure compliance.
•	Identify the critical steps to source and select products, calculate ROI, and set pricing for selling on Amazon.com.
•	Develop a comprehensive global selling strategy considering market research, localisation, and international shipping.
•	Develop an omnichannel plan to integrate Amazon.com with other sales channels to reach wider audience and drive business growth.
title: Digital Entrepreneurship in the Era of Cross-border e-Commerce: Mastering Selling Strategies on Amazon.com [Classroom Facilitated]

content:
The Metaverse offers a parallel virtual universe to all of us and opens up a whole new world of economic prospects, from virtual music events to Non-Fungible Token-based products (NFT), to name a few. Owing to its vast potential in benefitting the digital world, many big tech giants are already taking a leap and entering the world of Metaverse. The virtual reality universe calls for techies and individuals who want to build their skills in this ecosystem. This certificate programme aims to provide a deeper understanding of the Metaverse and offer participants a glimpse of the emerging future of the Web and the way we will interact with it. It will enable participants to comprehend the Metaverse in a more effective manner, giving them a significant advantage in the newly emerging digital world. 

Module 1 allows participants to demystify the Metaverse, deepen their understanding and learn about its applications and business opportunities.
objective:
At the end of the 3-day module, participants will be able to:
• Learn about the concepts of blockchain and Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs)
• Understand how Metaverse works, usage of blockchain and role of Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) in the Web 3.0 space
• Explore the possible socioeconomic impacts of Metaverse
• Explore the business opportunities in a virtual world
• Insights into the current developments of the Metaverse
• Understand the challenges and regulations within the Metaverse
title: Advanced Certificate in Web 3.0 Module 1: Understanding the Metaverse and Web 3.0

content:
Ecommerce has become the best and easiest way to sell your products. With an ecommerce business, you can sell whenever and wherever you want, without worries of maintaining a brick-and-mortar store. 

While many want to try their hands at running or managing an ecommerce business, it can be difficult to know where to start. In this course, you will be guided from start to finish on building an ecommerce business. 

From deciding on a product catalogue to creating a digital marketing strategy, this 2-day course covers everything you need to know to run a successful ecommerce business.

Led by an expert trainer and success in ecommerce, you will be closely guided through the process, using a mix of both theory and practical exercises. Trainees will leave this course understanding how to conceptualise a business from scratch, identify target audiences, and develop a strong brand identity, among other critical elements.
objective:
By the end of the class, trainees will be able to:

• Conceptualise an ecommerce business from scratch
• Identify and add trending products to the product inventory
• Define a target audience to market and sell to 
• Conduct competitor analysis within the ecommerce landscape to devise competitive strategies
• Define and develop a brand identify and clear brand message for an ecommerce business 
• Create a set of processes to operate an ecommerce business with minimal and streamlined resources
• Identify the right platforms to build an ecommerce business on
• Plan the setup of an ecommerce storefront and/or e-market place to facilitate the sales of products online
• Develop an ecommerce digital marketing strategy and go-to-market plan
title: WSQ Ecommerce Strategy

content:
In the digital era, Edtech has emerged as a transformative force, dramatically reshaping the landscape of teaching and learning. In order to stay relevant, educators and organisational leaders need to leverage emerging technologies to achieve new levels of productivity, implement useful digital tools to expand learning opportunities for learners and provide them with innovative and engaging learning experiences. Through a series of six modules offered in collaboration with SuperCharger Ventures - the largest Edtech-only accelerator globally, participants will explore emerging Edtech and Artificial Intelligence (AI) innovations, gain insights into best practices for fostering innovation in teaching and learning, and engage in hands-on experiences with various applications and tools.

In Module 1, participants will explore the evolution of Edtech and its relevance in modern education. They will understand the key drivers behind its development and the importance of creating an engaging and interactive learning environment. Additionally, they will gain insights into global Edtech investment trends, and growth opportunities within the industry, and examine how the recent pandemic acted as a catalyst for the accelerated adoption and innovation of Edtech solutions. By the end of the module, participants will be equipped with a solid foundation in Edtech fundamentals, empowering them to navigate the ever-changing landscape of the sector.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand how to define Edtech and its relevance to modern education
• Learn about the key stakeholders in the Edtech ecosystem
• Identify key milestones and influential players in the evolution of Edtech
• Understand global Edtech dynamics and investment trends
title: Advanced Certificate in Innovative Educational Technologies Module 1: Edtech Fundamentals (Classroom, Synchronous & Asynchronous E-Learning)

content:
The exponential growth of the internet, globalization and the pandemic have accelerated the push for digital transformation in all sectors.   Companies have pivoted and reinvented themselves to remain relevant.  Much of this transformation involve changing processes and workflow to gain efficiencies, productivity and competitive advantages, leading to increase revenues and profitability. Businesses started to make investments in technology and retrained their workforces to support those new processes and workflows. 

A result of the digital transformation was a dramatic increase in the types and quantities of data they began to accumulate. These businesses soon realised that they could use the deep understanding of that data for competitive and even absolute advantages.  However, the realisation that whilst they had skilled managers and engineers, there was a need for the skill to now work with the data they had.

There is a new driver for sustainable employability and that is Data and Information Literacy.  The data and information literate professional does more than just crunch numbers.  The expectation is for data professionals to add value by bringing their domain knowledge – engineering, finance, logistics, etc. – into data activities like data sourcing, wrangling, management, analysis and communication. 

“Data literacy Is the ability to read, write and communicate data in context, including an understanding of data sources and constructs, analytical methods and techniques applied; and the ability to describe the use case, application and resulting value.” – Gartner

In a nutshell, being data and information literate is about being able to:
• Seek out, acquire and manage the data that is going into the organization, used within the organization and communicated by the organization.
• Analyze and interpret data.
• Report and present the findings or insights through dashboards and other means.

The majority of companies today realize the value of a
objective:

content:
For a digital marketing professional to be effective in content marketing and advertising campaigns, you will need to master the art of communicating with clarity and purpose.

This 16-hour copywriting and content writing course will equip you with the tools to write engaging content and persuasive ad copy for the various digital channels, to grow your audience and get them to perform desired actions.

In recent years, the organic reach of content marketing efforts by organisations on social media such as Facebook has declined to painfully low levels due to overwhelming content vying for our attention (although some argue that Facebook is forcing organisations to advertise on their platform).

On the other hand, the recent implementation of laws to protect customer privacy, the introduction of ad blockers, and the disabling of third party cookies by major browsers such as Safari, Firefox and by 2022, Chrome, have and will continue to hurt organisations who want to advertise online.

What is more, advancements over the years in A.I. and machine learning have resulted in highly intelligent algorithms that are able to suss out undesirable (Black Hat) S.E.O. practices such as keyword stuffing, spammy links, and misleading redirects.

So, where does this leave organisations who want to promote their brand online?

The answer lies in committing to pursue excellence in writing and creating content. This means no more mediocre content, no more unengaging content, and no more content that is of little value to consumers.

Where to begin? Right here in this course, where ideas are crystalised in writing to propel your content marketing and advertising campaigns to great heights.
objective:
By the end of the course, trainees will be able to:

• Use the 5 Cs (Company-Consumer-Communication- Channel-Conversion) to plan your content marketing and advertising campaigns.
• Apply any combination of the 6 Key Writing Approaches to write effective copy for a social media ad and landing page.
• Incorporate a wide range of writing techniques to engage and persuade your audience.
• Write for a variety of media/channels including your website and social media.
• Apply creative writing and editing principles to produce content that is fresh and original.
• Ensure your writing is contributing to your organisation’s goals and evaluate the performance of your posts and ads.
title: WSQ Copywriting and Content Writing Course

content:
LU1: Identifying Online and Phone Scams
LU1 is fundamental as it sets the groundwork for the entire course. This unit introduces learners to the various types of online and phone scams, using analysis of recent phishing scam campaigns and real-world case studies. The focus on identifying scams and frauds (A1) is pivotal as it develops the learner's ability to recognize potential threats, a critical first step in scam prevention. By starting with identification (LO1), learners are equipped with the necessary knowledge base to discern legitimate communications from fraudulent ones, which is essential before they can effectively protect against these threats.

LU2: Assessing and Protecting Online and Phone Scams
Building on the foundational knowledge from LU1, LU2 delves into the assessment of risks associated with online and phone scams and strategies to protect personal and business information (LO2). This unit not only educates learners on scam and fraud recognition (K2) but also focuses on safeguarding techniques (A2). The inclusion of real-world case studies ensures that learners can relate theoretical knowledge to practical scenarios. This unit is critical as it transitions the learners from mere identifica-tion to the implementation of protective measures, thereby enhancing their skill set to proactively de-fend against scams.

LU3: Responding to Cyber Security Threats
The final unit, LU3, addresses the advanced aspect of the course - responding to cyber security threats (LO3). This unit educates learners on the best practices for engaging with authorities and rel-evant teams (K3), along with escalation and communication protocols (A3). This progression is vital as it empowers learners to not only recognize and protect against scams but also to take active measures in responding and reporting these incidents. By the end of this unit, learners are expected to be proficient in communicating and escalating online and phone scam incidents to relevant authori-
objective: A step-by-step approach to cyber security ensures each critical aspect of scam prevention is thoroughly covered, allowing learners to build upon their knowledge and skills in a structured and effective manner. The course is designed to transform learners from being potential victims to proactive defenders against online and phone scams in their personal and professional lives.
title: WSQ Understanding Scams and Frauds in the Digital World

content:
The E-commerce Ecosystem Content and Social Media Marketing program is an immersive two-day experience designed for e-commerce businesses seeking to stay ahead of the curve and dominate the competition through effective content and social media marketing strategies. This program provides a deep dive into the complexities of crafting a winning content and social media marketing plan, executing it with captivating content creation, and harnessing the power of social media promotion to reach the target audience.

Participants will gain a comprehensive understanding of the power of content and social media marketing in e-commerce, from understanding the definition and significance of content and social media marketing to exploring key components of a content and social media marketing plan and learning from real-world e-commerce success stories.

The program also delves into the art of storytelling in e-commerce and how to craft compelling stories that resonate with the target audience. Participants will also explore the intricacies of promoting content on social media and other e-commerce channels and learn how to measure the success of their campaigns.

By the end of the program, participants will leave feeling empowered and confident in their ability to drive business growth through smart, authoritative, and convincing content and social media marketing. The program includes an interactive quiz to evaluate the participants' understanding, a review of their personalized and custom-built templates, sharing of best practices, and a final Q and A session. They will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to elevate their business with e-commerce capabilities through bold and impactful content and social media marketing strategies.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
● Develop effective content marketing strategies and tactics for e-commerce, including persuasive content creation and storytelling
● Keep up with evolving consumer habits in e-commerce, digital, and social spaces to inform content and social media strategies
● Leverage personas to achieve success in e-commerce, social media, and digital platforms
● Craft comprehensive social media marketing strategies for e-commerce, and use relevant metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to monitor and enhance performance
● Drive e-commerce marketing and branding success by producing captivating content and effectively utilizing Paid Earned Shared Owned (PESO) channels
title: E-commerce Ecosystem Content and Social Media Marketing Strategies for Business Growth

content:
This Website and Landing Page Conversion Optimisation course will transform learners into a data-driven conversion rate specialist. Companies globally are spending almost $3.03 billion in advertising dollars. But many are leaking revenue and wasting money with their advertising/marketing efforts because of poor and inefficient websites. It doesn’t matter how much ad dollars and promotions they do if their website is underperforming.
To improve website ROI and performance, marketers need to implement a methodical process called Conversion Rate Optimisation.
 
It is a process that allows you to optimise their on-site goals by running data-driven experiments to remove friction and increase conversions. This helps them to increase qualified leads from existing website traffic, improve prospect retention and most importantly, close more sales online.

Learners should sign up for this course if they:
• Have been studying their analytics reports month after month, but can’t understand why their traffic isn’t converting – Learn how and what to analyse in order to spot and fix any high friction elements
• Need to optimise the landing page conversions, but are unsure where to begin.
• Are not getting positive returns for their paid advertising campaigns – Doubling their conversion rates, means reducing the ad spend
• Don’t know how to read the reports nor identify gaps in their conversion funnels – Address these gaps and achieve quick wins to boost conversions
• Don’t really understand what the customers really want – Apply consumer psychology principles and see from the customers’ perspective

By the end of this course, they will learn step-by-step how to improve their bottom-line through landing page optimisation, website testing, identifying digital insights and implementing actionable strategies.
objective:
By the end of this course, learner will be able to:
• Adopt the mind-set of a conversion rate optimiser and demonstrate an understanding of the fundamental concepts of conversion rate optimisation
• Apply persuasion techniques through understanding consumer psychology to increase conversion rates
• Optimise landing pages and develop wireframes that enhance user experience, leading to higher conversion rates
• Analyse performance of marketing channels through digital analytics tools and develop conversion funnels
• Conduct customer research and user centred testing to understand user behaviour on technical platforms
• Develop and manage a conversion rate optimisation plan
title: WSQ Website and Landing Page Conversion Optimisation

Under the master plan, a slew of initiatives such as a Cybersecurity Trustmark for enterprises that practise good cybersecurity and newly established processes to boost Singapore’s cybersecurity defence will be put in place to safeguard digital assets.

content: With the advent of digitalization of functions in organizations, increasingly more and more digital data are created and stored. Data is now the oil that drives organizational business intelligence for greater value. It is collected, stored, extracted, analysed and reported. Traditionally, database systems have been used to store them for these purposes. With the advancement in database technologies, new ways of storing data have been proposed to store and process, particularly, big data. This course teaches the concepts of data, big data, and database systems for managing data as well as big data.
objective:
This course will equip learners with the following competencies: 
•	Learn what is data and big data 
•	Learn the types of database structure 
•	Learn the types of relationships in databases
•	Learn to determine which database is right for an organization 
•	Learn what is NoSQL or non-relational database 
•	Build a strong foundation in managing data and big data in organizations
title: Data and Database Systems

content:
Digital & Social Media Marketing is the buzz word in today’s digitalized world. Individuals and organizations jumped to this bandwagon without adequately understanding why and what it can do for us. Instead of blindly hopping into the latest craze, how can one start to master it to tell your story instead of being mastered by it?

Digital & Social Media Marketing For Beginners is targeted at individuals and corporations that want to take the first steps in the journey towards digital marketing to reach customers effectively. Through hands on activities, participants will learn how to make basic digital & social media marketing strategy customised to telling your personal and organisational story.
objective:
Introduction to Digital & Social Media Marketing
- Why Digital & Social Media Marketing?
- Making sense of the Digital and Social Media Marketing landscape
 
Storytelling with Digital & Social Media Marketing

Continuous Learning in Digital & Social Media Marketing

- Consultation to strategizing using Digital & Social Media Marketing

content:
Learning outcomes include:
1.	Enabling a clear understanding and the ability to articulate key agile concepts and methodology.
2.	Gaining a practical overview to guide planning and participation in agile practices, including ceremonies and selected tools.
3.	Learning about critical success factors and dos and don’ts from real world examples of agile projects.
4.	Tapping on toolkits to encourage agile mindsets and behaviors in day-to-day activities.
objective:
The proposed curriculum includes 8 modules:
1.	Agile Fundamentals & Mindset: Covers foundational principles and values of Agile methodologies, including understanding the Agile Manifesto, 12 Agile Principles, and the mindset shift for agility in project management and product development.
2.	Scrums & Sprints: Explores the Scrum framework, emphasizing effective scrum teams and delivering within Sprints.
3.	Agile Roles: Examines various roles within Agile teams, detailing responsibilities and expectations for roles like Scrum Master, Product Owner, and Development Team members. Emphasizes collaboration and effective communication among these roles.
4.	Epics, Product Features & Backlogs: Teaches breaking down project requirements into manageable components, covering creation of Epics, defining Product Features, and crafting User Stories to guide development and facilitate communication.
5.	Estimation: Focuses on Agile estimation techniques, exploring methods like story points, planning poker, and relative sizing to estimate effort for User Stories. Aims to develop a shared understanding of team capacity and improve release planning accuracy.
6. Kick Start the Sprint: Addresses practical aspects of preparing for a Sprint, covering Sprint 0 activities in preparing the product backlog for a well-organized start.
7. Roadmap Planning: Explores techniques for aligning Agile development with organizational goals, including creating and maintaining Agile roadmaps, prioritizing features, managing dependencies, and adapting to changes in business priorities.
8. Sprint Ceremonies & Artefacts: Covers various ceremonies and artifacts in Agile development, such as Sprint Review, Sprint Retrospective, and Daily Stand-ups. Participants gain insights into the purpose and value of artifacts like burndown charts, velocity, and the Definition of Done.
title: Agile Orientation for Digital Transformation: Concepts, Practices and Mindsets

content: The marketing domain is evolving at a rapid pace. In a fully digital world, marketeers need new marketing strategies to stay ahead of the competition. With more companies globally adopting digital platforms and assets, classic marketing techniques—including broad segmentation, lockstep campaigns with multiple handovers, and marketing funnels through which all consumers move in tandem—have no place in the digital age. Smart digital marketing is the way forward. In this module, participants will be armed with the know-how, the experience and the insights to be able to work and speak with authority in the digital business space.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Understand the concept of smart digital marketing and the relevant technologies required to achieve superior edge in digital marketing
• Manage the pitfalls of digital marketing in a VUCA context
• Appreciate the concept of digital marketing assets and how to achieve best value and improve company resilience for digital marketer  
• Discuss how smart digital marketing converges with the data analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning
• Discuss the emerging trend in smart digital marketing and the impact on society – brand interaction
title: Advanced Certificate in Business Digitalisation and Transformation Module 8: Integrated and Digital Marketing for Smart Business

content: This certificate introduces the art and craft of designing, managing and producing events. Its modules explain how events are experienced in the ‘now’ and why successful events— whether in a physical or digital space—can create a positive memory of an experience and a connected brand. Students learn how to think through  and plan and execute events in all the various aspects and levels. Students appreciate why event planning and event management empowers the organiser and the audience, increasing customer satisfaction. Students start off learning entrepreneurial skills and their application in the free market (the gig economy). Students then move on to analyse different types of local and international events while acquiring the basic principles and practices required to gain insight into how organisations use events to entice and engage visitors. Students also acquire practical skills in project management and scheduling, cultivating the ability to plan, map, and execute a project management plan to industry standards.
objective: As per course description

content:
We are in a time of exciting change full of opportunity. Digital services are helping organizations to compete in the modern digital economy. This new digital era, known as the ‘Fourth Industrial Revolution’ is characterized by the unavoidable interaction between humans, digital technologies and physical assets. It has created an increasingly fast-paced and complex environment, requiring organizations to be more agile, better equipped to adapt what they do, and ready to adopt new ways of working to succeed in a volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous (VUCA) world.
 
The course enables IT and digital leaders in the financial services industry to influence and drive strategic decisions through digital strategies. Effective digital strategies have already seen quantifiable results through the emergence of digital banking, mobile banking, application of blockchain technology, the integration of automation and Artificial Intelligence into both business processes, investment decision-making and improving the customer journey. Additionally, the rise of Fintech puts the imperative on traditional financial organisation to digitally transform to remain competitive and relevant.

Leaders in the financial services industry need to be equipped with knowledge on developing strategies that can successfully exploit current and future technology to win in the marketplace.
objective:
On completion of this course, the following learning outcomes  will be achieved:
- Demonstrate the use of ITIL Guiding Principles in Digital and IT Strategy (DITS) decisions
- Leverage digital strategy to respond to digital disruption
- Understand relationships between DITS with the Service Value System to create value
- Use DITS to remain viable in environments disrupted by digital disruption, achieve market relevance and operational excellence
- Identify and risks and opportunities in DITS
- Define, advocate and implement Digital & IT Strategy
title: ITIL4 Digital & IT Strategy Preparatory Course

content:
What’s lacking with today's business owners, is an appreciation of how to understand and manage digital marketing in today’s fast paced digital economy. Do they have a realistic strategy that’s based on addressing a business objective? How would they decide on a digital platform and for what purpose? Is their planned budget sufficient? How do they measure success and plan for further optimisation?

This 5-day programme addresses these gaps and provides business owners with the confidence to know how to be effective in dealing with their own teams and/or an agency/vendor in the analysis, planning, implementation and measurement of an effective digital marketing plan. The foundational programme designed by industry practitioner aims to equip marketers with the latest knowledge and best practices in digital marketing including Search, Email, Social Media, and Optimisation.

This will be an extremely practical course as individuals/teams will have to deliver a plan that will be graded and this plan can be used as a template for their own organisation’s digital marketing plan.
objective:
Understand and map Consumer Decision Journey
Understand and create Personas
Understand and craft Messaging
Understand the fundamentals of a digital marketing strategy/plan including budgeting
Understand and apply foundational concepts in Search and Display, Social Media, Email Marketing, Analytics and Optimisation
Assess business needs and goals and formulate a digital marketing strategy Utilise a structured framework to selecting and assessing digital media and design a strategic digital marketing plan for the organisation
title: Foundation in Digital Marketing –  Creating The Complete Digital Marketing Plan For Your Business
trainingProviderAlias: SINGAPORE UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY AND DESIGN

content:
In today's digital world, embracing digital technologies is imperative for businesses of all sizes. Digital Transformation (DX) involves the use of cutting-edge technologies, tools, and practices to drive innovation, boost operational efficiency, and enhance overall performance. The Digital Transformation Bootcamp in Singapore is designed to equip small and medium-sized enterprises with the skills necessary to create a successful digital transformation plan and drive their businesses forward. 

This course is delivered in blended mode which comprises of synchronous flipped class and assignments and asynchronous e learning sessions
This course contains following 5 Instructional Units
1. Digital Transformation Technologies and Strategy
2. Tech Enabled Operations & Secured Digital Workplace  
3. Digital Technology Roadmaps
4. Digital Business Innovation and Lean Canvas
5. Industry Digital Plan (IDP) and Industry Transformation Maps (ITMs)
objective:
At the end of the course, learners attaining the following Learning Outcomes is the objective of this course
1. Identify and Evaluate the tools, technologies, and concepts required to select the emerging technologies and plan the digital transformation strategy 
2. Categorize the different tech enabled tools, techniques and technologies used for workflow process improvement and optimisation
3. Identify, evaluate, and select the right technologies to drive the digital transformation journey    
4. Examine the innovation process of digital businesses, analyse the company's digital transformation goals, and build the lean canvas
5. Analyse the Industry Digital Plan (IDP) developed by the regulatory body and identify areas in the company’s digital transformation plan for further refinement
title: WSQ Digital Transformation (SF) (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)

content:
1. Describe emerging technologies and business trends in the digital marketing landscape
2. Explore customer needs and customer journeys in the digital landscape
3. Analyze and evaluate an existing brand’s digital marketing strategy
4. Make recommendations to an organisation for improving their digital marketing
5. Discuss the impact and dangers of wide scale data collection on personal freedoms and society
6. Discuss trends that will shape future digital marketing
objective: This course aims to introduce students to the global digital marketing landscape and its impact on meeting consumers’ needs. Students will be equipped with knowledge to evaluate and design digital strategies and activities for companies. Students will learn to analyze the digital marketing performance of a company and its competitors. Students will be guided to explore and propose digital marketing strategies for companies, products and brands.
title: Digital Marketing (Classroom & Asynchronous e-learning)

content:
The programme will cover the following areas:

1. Introduction To The Digital World
2. Digital Strategy for Businesses 101
3. The Relevance of SEO in Digital Strategy
4. Executing a SEO Campaign
5. Measuring Digital ROI
objective: For business owners and decision makers who are heading the digital commerce and marketing, this program will provide the knowledge that will support them in making business decisions within the digital space. In this program, participants will explore how the digital world function, assess or devise digital strategy that aids in decision making, understand the workings of SEO in execution, and project business returns from digital campaigns.
title: Digital Strategy & the 101 of Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) [Synchronous E-Learning]

content:
At the end of this course, you will be able to: 
(1) Understand what Digital Marketing is 
(2) Appreciate the key players in the Digital Marketing world 
(3) Comprehend the important digital marketing tools that can impact you and your organization.
objective:
This micro-learning online course will equip you with the skills and knowledge on the essentials of digital marketing. It will deepen your understanding on the world of digital marketing and its impacts on individuals and organizations to reach and communicate with your target audience. 

You will learn the basics of Digital Marketing focusing on: - Email Marketing - Search Engine Marketing (think Google) - Social Media Marketing (think Facebook, Instagram and Twitter)
title: MLC - 12 Essentials of Digital Marketing

content:
Brands – big or small, business-to-business, business-to-consumer or governments – have been around for hundreds of years, working through brick and mortar outlets to bring their products or services to the people. The digital revolution has changed all that.

Today, Digital Natives as well as Digital Immigrants use online as their first port of call; to inform, compare, decide. And they judge brands not just based on what they are selling but also how they are selling it, which experiences they offer and what they stand for.

This class looks at digital as an opportunity – to create better experiences in segments that customers flock to, consistent across all online and offline touchpoints, and to understand how brands can use data obtained from online sources  to generate insights.
objective:
At the end of this 2 day course, you will: 

- Analyse and understand the digital consumer and what they are looking for from a brand experience
- Learn from the online strategies of winning regional brands
- Develop concepts for creating winning online experiences 
- Learn how digital has changed the world
- Understand key drivers for the digital consumer
title: Digital Strategy: Building Digital Capabilities to Transform Customer Experiences

content:
At the end of the programme, learners will be able to perform work processes and activities using identified digital technology tools, systems and software

Learning Units
LU1: Develop Essential Digital Fluency Skills
LU2: Digital Technology Applications
LU3: Data Privacy Compliance
LU4: Cyber Security Threats
objective:
Knowledge
K1	Digital terminologies
K2	Digital etiquettes
K3	Types of digital search and information collection tools
K4	Types of digital technology tools, systems and software
K5	Types of technology-enabled communication channels
K6	Organisation’s InfoComm Technology troubleshooting and Information Technology (IT) back-up processes
K7	Organisation’s IT, personal data and privacy policies
K8	Types of cyber security risks
K9	Organisation’s policies to monitor cyber security risks

Abilities
A1	Interpret instructions and actions based on digital terminologies
A2	Operate identified digital technology tools, systems and software to perform own work processes and activities
A3	Present information using identified digital technology tools, systems and software
A4	Exchange information with other stakeholders using identified technology-mediated communication channels
A5	Perform searches to source information using digital search and information collection tools
A6	Assess the credibility of information sourced using digital search and information collection tools
A7	Organise digital content to be stored and retrieved in line with organisational requirements
A8	Adhere to organisation’s personal data and privacy policies
A9	Follow organisation’s cyber security policies to identify potential risks

content:
- Disruption & Innovation in Financial Services
- Digital Transformation
- Digital Banks
- Key Components of Digital Banks
- Customer Engagement
- Target Operating Model
- Key Success Factors
- Case Studies
objective:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) has announced the issuance of up to five new digital bank licences, which is open to non‐bank players. This workshop looks at how to set up a digital bank ‐ types, functions, strategies, market focus, customer engagement and operating models. Key learning objectives include:

• Gain an overview on disruption and innovations in
financial services
• Analyze the different strategies adopted by digital
banks
• Acquire practical framework for launching digital
banks
• Understand the key components of a digital bank

objective: This module is designed for individuals seeking to develop an operating knowledge of transportation operations management relating to manufacturing and supply chain. Participants will acquire concepts and operational specifics of commercial intermodal transportation pertaining to freight movement. They will also learn about intermodal services, terminals, equipment and information systems and the interactions between individual modes and intermediaries.
title: Advanced Certificate in Logistics and Supply Chain Management Module 3: Order Fulfilment and Transportation Management

content:
As process control technology evolves rapidly and the digital age of Fieldbus instruments emerges, it is necessary for technologists who are involved in the field of process control and instrumentation to continuously upgrade their technical skills and knowledge to remain employable.

This Advanced Diploma in Process Control and Instrumentation (NAPCI) is intended to offer post-diploma training in the area of Process Control and Instrumentation. The targeted participants are employees of companies which are in the process control related industries such as instrumentation, control, chemical, pharmaceutical, manufacturing, servicing, and maintenance, as well as staff of research and development organisations.
objective:
Course aims are as follows:

•	To provide students with the theoretical knowledge and practical skills necessary for graduates to assist engineers in the field of electrical, electronics, computer, instrumentation, control and automation systems.

•	To provide students with the knowledge of the latest development in the fields of Instrumentation, Automation and Process control technology.
title: Certificate in Industrial Networks ad Cybersecurity & Process Control

content: Learn about the different origins and characteristics of specialty tea products and how tea plantation terroir and different processing methods affect flavour and quality. This course is recommended for junior tea specialists, baristas and front of the house staff who are required to prepare, serve and recommend specialty tea and tea products to the customers based on their preferences.
objective:
Learning Outcomes:
1) Acquire the knowledge and application of a variety of specialty tea products and related equipment for the preparation and serving specialty tea
2) Demonstrate skills and techniques in preparing and serving specialty tea in accordance with the standard operating procedures
3) Identify customer preferences and recommend an acceptable specialty tea option to the customer
title: Provide Specialty Tea Service (Asynchronous eLearning + Classroom)

content: This 27-hour programme enables participants to gain an understanding of the basic principles necessary to extend existing businesses to incorporate e-business and digital platforms, or to start a brand new business. This programme is designed for individuals who have an interest in developing the knowledge, attitudes and skills necessary to build a successful e-business arm, or to become digital entrepreneurs online or on mobile. The programme will value add to the participant’s digital business development journey.
objective: This programme is designed for individuals who have an interest in developing the knowledge, attitudes and skills necessary to build a successful e-business arm, or to become digital entrepreneurs online or on mobile. The programme will value add to the participant’s digital business development journey.
title: Executive Entrepreneurship Programme (Developing Your Digital Business and Digital Marketing Successfully) (sync e-learning)

content: Provide participants with the basic knowledge of data wrangling, Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and data management basics and approaches. Through the use of applications like SQLite, participants will have practical experience in conducting data mining of databases.
objective: Turning “raw” data into “usable form” is a necessary step before any data analysis can be done. As businesses and organizations get inundated with more and more data from a myriad of internal and external sources, the data needs to cleaned, formatted and prepared in a way that can be used for various analysis and data visualization. It is estimated that an analysts spend as much as 75% of his/her time just performing data wrangling and EDA tasks. In this segment, participants will learn about data structures, how to handle and manage different types of data, how to prepare data for analysis and data visualization.
title: Data Wrangling, Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and Data Management (Synchronous and Asynchronous e-Learning)

content: Artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) based technologies are increasingly present in the service and process experiences of leading organisations. However, the application of technology alone is not enough to succeed - the guidance of a broader Design Thinking mindset is necessary. This course will develop an understanding of the foundations of AI and ML, before developing a capability to deploy "Intelligent" and "Cognitive" tools within Process and Service Design contexts.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day course, participants will be able to: 
• Understand what "AI" and "ML" means for process, product, and service transformation
• Apply "Intelligent Assistant" and "Recommendation Engine" tools to enhance process, product, and service experiences
• Mobilise "AI" and "ML" within a Design Thinking Project
• Understand the governance challenges of "AI-Assisted" process, product, and service design
title: Applied Design Thinking: The Role of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

content: The construction industry had been perceived as a labour-intensive and low-tech one. The adoption of technologies, work processes and best practices to boost construction productivity has revolutionised the way we build. To prepare the industry for such adoption, this programme aims to hone the skills and enhance the knowledge of built environment professionals in emerging areas such as Integrated Digital Delivery (IDD), Virtual Design & Construction (VDC), Lean Construction (LC), Pre-fabricated Bathroom Unit (PBU), Pre-fabricated and Prefinished Volumetric Construction (PPVC), Mass Engineered Timber (MET) and automation in construction.
objective: This certificate equips construction industry professionals with the latest construction productivity trends and technology needed to attain higher technical competencies. Learners will gain critical knowledge in process and quality improvement, management skills, and value engineering. Learners will also comprehend the new construction technologies for different trades including challenges and benefits of building offsite.
title: ADVANCED CERTIFICATE IN CONSTRUCTION PRODUCTIVITY (ACCP)

content: The course is designed to equipped students with the basic skills needed to create visual reports with data analytics using Power BI.  Upon course completion, learners will be able to consume and transform data using the Power BI desktop application, create models from raw data sources and configure Dashboards using the Power BI Service.
objective:
•	Perform Power BI desktop data transformation. 
•	Describe Power BI desktop modelling. 
•	Create a Power BI desktop visualization. 
•	Implement the Power BI service. 
•	Describe how to connect to Excel data. 
•	Describe how to collaborate with Power BI data. 
•	Connect directly to data stores. 
•	Describe the Power BI analytic and visual API. • Describe the Power BI mobile app.
title: Analyzing and Visualizing Data with Power BI (SF)

content:
The Advanced Diploma in Medical and Pharmaceutical Technology is a part-time CET course, consist of the following modules: 
1. Mammalian Cell Culture (36 hrs)
2. Upstream Processing (36 hrs)
3. Downstream Processing (36 hrs)
4. Drug Formulation (45 hrs)
objective: The PDC in Biopharmaceutical Manufacturing (PDC-BPM) provides learners with hands-on skills in the production of biopharmaceuticals, starting from mammalian cell culture, raw material processing, bioreactor fermentation, to cell harvesting and end product purification. The Drug Formulation module focuses on principles and practices in formulating and testing of pharmaceutical products.
title: Post Diploma Certificate in Biopharmaceutical Manufacturing - Part of Advanced Diploma in Medical and Pharmaceutical Technology (ADMP1)

content:
Participants will be introduced to Technology for Productivity (i.e. Cloud productivity, Robotic process automation (RPA), Enterprise resource planning (ERP) and workflow management) and be able to plan the foundations of digital operations for a mid-size setup.
They will learn:
1. Two common tools in the market and their value propositions
2. Market technology leaders, section criteria and deployment recommendations
3. Technology adoption for productivity gain
4. Common tools in the market and ways to improve operation excellence through the adoption
5. Industry 4.0, International Standard - 95 (ISA-95), Reference Architectural Model Industry 4.0 (RAMI 4.0) and their practical deployment in improving enterprise productivity.
objective:
At the end of the course, the participants will learn:
Office productivity suites and collaboration
• Robotic process automation
• Workflow management software
• Enterprise resource planning
• Enterprise resource planning (ERP) in industry 4.0
• Xero individual practice
title: Technology for Productivity (Synchronous e-Learning)

content:
Upon completion of the course, graduates should be able to:
a.	Work effectively in large or small organisations
b.	Identify legal issues relating to the law enforcement and security industry and apply them in their work
c.	Plan and implement security measures for an organisation, physical installations and transportation by land, air and sea
d.	Identify cybersecurity threats and implement cybersecurity protection and response plans
e.	Conduct basic digital forensic investigations 
f.	Apply concepts of criminal justice and punishment to their daily work
g.	Apply psychological and behavioural science principles to law enforcement and security work
h.	Use office productivity and communication tools effectively
i.	Analyse data and statistics as tools for law enforcement
objective: The aim of MC is to equip participants with the knowledge in business skills & law so as to perform the roles of law enforcement officers and private security officers, supervisors and managers.
title: Modular Certificate in Business Skills & Law (in Diploma in Policing & Security Management)

content: The Capstone Project - Digital Transformation is a comprehensive course that provides learners with the opportunity to apply the concepts and skills attained throughout their program to a real-world digital transformation project. This hands-on, practical course covers the latest tools, technologies and best practices for driving innovation and improving organizational performance through digital transformation. learners will work on a project for a company or organization, and present their findings and recommendations for digital transformation initiatives. Upon completion of this course, students will have a deep understanding of the digital transformation process and the skills needed to drive digital transformation initiatives in a real-world setting.
objective:
At the end of the course, learners attaining the following Learning Outcomes is the objective of this course
1.Identify and Evaluate the tools, technologies, and concepts required in digital transformation planning and process improvement
2.Analyse and plan the different tech enabled tools, techniques, and digital transformation strategies used for process improvement and optimisation
3. Identify relevant processes and determine the digital resources required to deploy the digital transformation initiatives
4.Examine the new processes, communicate and translate the learning to all the stakeholders, and validate the effectiveness of the proposed process improvement
5. Analyse the Industry Transformation Map (ITM) developed by the regulatory body and identify areas in the company’s digital transformation plan for further refinement
title: WSQ Capstone Project - Digital Transformation (SF) (Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning)

content: This programme will empower participants with the skills and confidence to exploit opportunities and accelerate business transformation and entrepreneurship using blockchain and digital assets. Through lectures, real-world case studies, discussions, and hands-on exercises participants will gain insights into various real-world applications of Blockchain and digital assets.
objective:
By the end of the programme, you will be able to:
•	Understand how blockchain and digital assets can help improve your business decisions,
•	Understand how to evaluate new and emerging technology and trends against the organisational needs and processes,
•	Understand the most recent ideas, techniques, and applications in blockchain and digital assets.
title: Digital Assets and Blockchain for Digital Finance

content:
Formulating a digital marketing strategy will help you to make informed decisions about your foray into the digital marketing arena, and ensure that marketing efforts are focused on the elements of digital marketing that are most relevant to your unique business.

 It is also crucial first step towards understanding how the constantly evolving digital marketplace relates to your business, and how it affects the relationship between your brand, your loyal customers, and your prospects.

Unlike conventional forms of marketing, the digital marketing is unique in its capacity on the scope of your marketing reach and the focus of your target audience. 

Using digital channel, your business can transcend from traditional constraints such as geography and time zones to connect with a wider audience and more cost effective.
objective:
1. The learner will be able to examine digital marketing concepts and features of various digital marketing channels and strategies
2. The learner will be able to evaluate marketing technologies and tools for branding
3. The learner will be able to select and differentiate appropriate digital marketing channels based on the digital marketing strategy
4. The learner will be able to distinguish key elements for marketing mix to achieve business objectives
5. The learner will be able to analyse performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of a digital marketing strategy
title: WSQ Integrated Branding & Digital Marketing Strategy

content: Learner will be able to learn to identify opportunities and evaluate risks of integrating digital technology tools, systems and software across work processes and activities
objective:
1.	Identify types of decision-making strategy and prioritisation frame-works
2.	Identify benefits of emerging digital tools and communication channels
3.	Evaluate emerging digital tools and communication channels to propose applications which drive efficiency and solve problems in own team
4.	Distinguish types of visualisation tools and techniques
5.	Apply different visualisation techniques and tools to analyse and present information
6.	Identify methods to evaluate suitability of digital technology tools, systems and software
7.	Identify types of metrics to measure effectiveness of digital tools, systems and software
8.	Assess the effectiveness of current digital technology tools
9.	Explain the technology implementation processes
10.	Classify processes in managing digital transformation
11.	Identify the components of problem solving in the digital age
12.	Analyse work processes and activities across own teams with digital tools, system or software to drive efficiency and solve problems
13.	Identify the risk assessment techniques to mitigate risk in a digital environment
14.	Appraise usage of digital tools towards the criteria, to avoid breaches of organisation's digital and IT policies	
15.	Develop strategies to manage cyber security risks
title: Managing Digital Technology for Business Resiliency (Classroom & Synchronous)

content:
Digital disruption and technologies continue to drastically alter competitive dynamics across industry and businesses.  Digital technologies transform the power balance between customers and business while simultaneously provide opportunities for business disruption. The rules for business success are being rewritten and organizations that do not embrace and embark on digital transformation risk demise. 

Strategic transformation initiatives need to be directed from the top and leaders need to build their competence in this area. Core concepts of strategy and leadership while still relevant need to be adapted for relevance in a digital era driving organization success and competitiveness.  There is no one formula for success and every organization needs to develop its unique digital strategy and execute it through a managed transformation process. This program aims to provide this content in a succinct and practical approach. Resource materials provided, case studies and frameworks worked on may be taken back for in-company application.
objective:
•  Understand Digitization & Digital Transformation 
•  Recognize the Strategic Importance of Digital Transformation 
•  Overview of Digital Technologies and their Impact on Business Competitiveness Process to Develop a Digital Strategy for Improved Competitiveness  
•  Learn how to Strategically Lead and Manage a Digital Transformation initiatives
title: Digital Transformation for Strategic Competitiveness

content:
On completion of the module, students should be able to design, construct, test and troubleshoot basic digital electronics circuits. They should also be able to construct prototype digital electronic circuits.

Digital Electronics (EC2002FP) is one of the modules leading to NITEC IN TECHNOLOGY - ELECTRONICS, COMPUTER NETWORKING & COMMUNICATIONS.
objective: On completion of the module, students should be able to design, construct, test and troubleshoot basic digital electronics circuits. They should also be able to construct prototype digital electronic circuits.
title: Digital Electronics

content: The digital economy is the growing part of the Singapore Economy and is expected to contribute almost US$ 10 Billion to the GDP. This new growth is expected to change the labour and business landscape. In this module, we will help to demystify the digital economy and provide an introduction into the workings of digital economy.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Gain an overview of the digital economy and how it is changing the business landscape
• Gain real-world insights into various aspects of the digital economy and the implication it has on traditional business
• Learn how digital economy can create business value that are different from traditional business
• Understand the factors that drive the digital economy
title: Advanced Certificate in Business Digitalisation and Transformation Module 1: Introduction to Digital Economy

content:
The rise and adoption of digital technologies have accelerated the pace of disruption in virtually every industry, creating critical challenges as well as immense opportunities. A fundamental understanding of the factors and drivers of the digital economy and how they impact business models would be pertinent for any business leader.
This course serves to ‘make simple’ and unravel the digital economy, with an overview of the landscape, how it disrupts traditional businesses, how it creates opportunities for new business models, and key factors for a successful digitalisation programme.
objective:
By attending this module, the trainees will:                
•	Understand the critical difference between digitisation, digitalisation, and digital transformation.
•	Insights into key strategic areas that have been transformed by digital technologies.
•	Understand effective digital strategies for both incumbents and challengers.
•	Explore the components of successful digital business models.
•	Understanding various emerging technologies fueling digital transformation.
title: Unravelling the Digital Economy

content:
Course Outline:
LO1: Interpret Key Characteristics and 5 Action Phases of Design Thinking
LO2: Identify Problem through Empathizing with Users
LO3: Define Clear Project and Business Objectives
LO4: Generate New Ideas to Solve the Defined Problem
LO5: Build Prototype to Visualise Ideas
LO6: Review Ideas to Decide on a Best Solution

Agenda:
Day 1- AM
Introduction to DT and Action Plan
• What is Design Thinking?
• 7 Types of Design Thinker / DT Checklist
• Speed Design Thinking

Day 1- PM
Empathize Phase
• How to Build Rapport
• How to Create Discussion Guide
• Compile Insights in Empathy Map
• What's a Persona and JTBD
• How to Convey Empathy by Storytelling

Day 2- AM
Define Phase
• Write the Design Brief
• 5 Types of Questions
• How to React to Your Boss
• Propose a DT Action Plan

• Standup Huddles

Day 2- PM
Ideate Phase
• Brainwriting
• Creative Exercises
• Affinity Map
• Prioritization Map
• Idea Evaluation

Day 3- AM
Prototype and Test Phase

• Physical Prototypes / Wireframes
• Storyboarding / Roleplays
• Assumptions and Questions
• How to Conduct a User Test
• What is the Outcome of User Tests?

Day 3- PM
Innovation Techniques
• What is Innovation and Design Thinking?
• Drawing Activities

• What If?
objective:
Feeling stuck in your career and not progressing with your promotion?

Faced with complex problems everyday and not knowing how to solve?

Companies are spending thousands on "Design Thinkers" and you want to elevate your value to be a problem-solver?

This is it! You need a certification to progress!

Problems right now are VUCA and has to be solved by Design Thinking:

Volatility (V) require an adaptable mindset to align rapidly changing demands.
Uncertainty (U) require a spirit of learning and experimentation.
Complexity (C) require a critical thinker that focus on the root of the problem. 
Ambiguity (A) require empathy and deep insight of the situation and context.

And that’s not all.. 

Do you think your customers are not heard enough and you hoped you can do something for them?

Do you feel some of your projects are just plain pointless and wished that you are targeting the right problem?

Do you feel you could get your team to be more creative and think out of the box?

Do you roll out some projects which you have absolutely no idea whether it will crash and burn?

 
3 most important skills (according to Forbes) in Digital Transformation:
- Critical Thinking (Problem-Solving)
- Creativity (Think Outside the Box)
- Collaboration (Working with Others)

One of the most comprehensive and professional 3-day WSQ Advanced Design Thinking in Singapore. It will empower you with effective framework and mindsets of a problem-solver, project manager and innovator in order to solve real-world problems.
title: WSQ Advanced Design Thinking

content:
This course will address the companies’ lack of knowledge related to digital leadership and expertise in:
1.	Digitalization, to develop digital business model, identifying the required digital technologies, 
establish the corresponding system & competency to support the technology adoption. 
2.	Develop with systematic approach to explore initiatives needed for digitalization.
objective: This course aims to provide leaders on how to lead their organization and people in the digital age, leveraging digital technologies to accelerate business model changes and achieve meaningful digital transformation.
title: Digital Leadership in the Age of AI

content:
Digital marketing has become an integral component of marketing. In order for businesses to effectively scale their reach and sales, digital marketing capabilities must be developed.

However, most people do not have a comprehensive understanding of digital marketing, much less an understanding of the strategies behind effective digital marketing, even though it features heavily in our everyday lives nowadays.

Due to this lack of knowledge and abilities, many companies end up running ineffective digital marketing campaigns.

The WSQ Strategic Digital Marketing course is designed to equip learners with a strong foundational understanding of the relations between the various elements of digital marketing.

The course will focus more on the strategic thinking behind your marketing efforts and explore actual situations encountered by the learners to help them with practical implementation of their plans.

On top of this, this course will also give you better insights on:

1. What are the latest digital marketing trends you can leverage on;

2. What are consumer’s online behavior you need to know;

3. How to pinpoint your ideal customers;

4. How you should connect with different groups of customers; and

5. How to evaluate and optimise your digital marketing funnel.
objective:
At the end of the course, learners will be able to:

1. Establish overall business objectives and current marketing trends

2. Analyse customer segments, market gaps and competitors

3. Develop a marketing strategy

4. Implement a marketing strategy
title: WSQ Strategic Digital Marketing

content: This new course, Diploma (Conversion) in Digital Marketing and Communication (NVDMC), caters to the demand from non-marketing participants who are seeking a career switch from backgrounds that are new to marketing, as well as upskill participants whose job scope has widened to encompass elements of digital marketing and communication as their companies are pivoting to stay relevant in current market circumstances.
objective: The Diploma (Conversion) in Digital Marketing and Communication course aim to equip participants with foundational knowledge and skills of digital marketing and digital marketing communication so that they can be effective in meeting the demands and challenges of the marketplace.
title: Certificate in Digital Marketing Fundamentals

content:
On completion of the module, students should be able to integrate digital media such as audio and video elements, animation and other media formats for various media platforms.

Digital Content Creation (DM4024FP) is one of the modules leading to HIGHER NITEC IN SERVICES - INTERACTIVE DESIGN.
objective: On completion of the module, students should be able to integrate digital media such as audio and video elements, animation and other media formats for various media platforms.
title: Digital Content Creation

content:
1. Demonstrate knowledge of the different types of tools, equipment, tableware and table-top items used in food and beverage service. 
2. Demonstrate knowledge of service components and ability to follow the organisation's standard operating procedures when preparing for service operations.
3. Perform opening and end of shift activities and follow proper handover procedures to ensure smooth communications and operations.
objective: To equip all service and front of house staff of food and beverage establishments with the basic knowledge and skills on set up,  opening, in service and closing activities to maintain smooth operations. e and cleanliness of the food and beverage service environments. The course also introduces learners new to the food services industry on essential service comments and impact to the organisation's service delivery standards if SOP is not followed.
title: Food and Beverage Service Level 1 (Asychronous eLearning + Classroom)

content:
Today's digital and regulatory environment requires that businesses meet data protection requirements in countries they operate in. 

This module provides participants with an understanding of data protection risk framework and how to audit for data protection. Participants will learn to audit, identify and analyse these data protection risks and implement changes to address identified gaps.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Implement a data protection risk framework according to the ISO 31000 standards
• Identify, analyse and assess different types of data protection risks 
• Apply various types of controls to manage data protection risks 
• Know how and when to conduct data protection audits 
• Apply audit methodologies and gaps analysis to meet data protection requirements
title: Advanced Certificate in Data Governance Systems Module 2: Data Protection Risks and Audit Management (Synchronous E-Learning)

content: Visual language is a system that conveys meaning through visual elements. When a visual language is meaningful and consistent, it makes it easier for your consumers to identify and relate to your content and products. In this module, participants will be equipped with an understanding of the use of design elements, colours, typography, and images to express their brand values and drive conversions through subconscious triggers. They will learn that design is not simply a glossy veneer that is applied after the ‘important’ work has been done. Instead, its impact is especially significant in the digital world we live in, where every generation is conditioned to think, communicate and interact visually.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Identify different media of visual language and describe what they represent
• Tap on the potential of colour and typography to design for impact
• Articulate how brand elements can be adapted for consumer loyalty
• Discern visual quality by identifying visual strengths and weaknesses
title: SMU-NAFA Advanced Certificate in Mastering Design Literacy for Marketing Module 2: The Power of Visual Language

content:
The rapid transformation of the retail landscape has brought about new challenges for retailers. To meet the shifting demands of increasingly diverse customers, sales professionals need to take a creative and interactive approach to sell in the digital age. Besides being product experts, sales professionals must also cultivate meaningful relationships with customers, while adopting new technologies and sales strategies. Stay ahead of the competition by developing your skills and mastering the art of selling to win more customers in the new retail landscape.

This course covers the following:
- Understand New Retail: New landscape, new customers
- Determine and meet diverse customer requirements
- Manage customer challenges
- Recommend solutions with relevant products and services
- Identify creative sales opportunities in online-to-offline commerce
- Appreciate the process of closing a sale
objective: On completion of this course, participants will be able to demonstrate the organisation’s service vision, and recognise the role that one plays in contributing to the service vision.
title: Service Leadership (SF - Associate) [AOP]

- Understand animation styles from 2D, 3D, Motion Graphics, Stop Motion and how they can be used to showcase products / services or complement your digital marketing campaigns

- Analyse the techniques and methods behind animated videos and determine what works best for your brand

- Know what type of formats are ideal when it comes to publishing your animation on different media platforms like Third-Party Marketplaces, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn

- Understand the workflow behind creating an animation from pre-production, production and post-production
