content:
This course is designed to provide a comprehensive introduction to transactional accounting with the use of Xero accounting software. 

Students will gain a strong foundation in preparing for transactional and double-entry accounting, producing accurate financial statements and reports. 

Furthermore, the course will delve into the effects of accounting standards on the presentation of financial information. 

Through hands-on exercises and practical applications, students will develop their accounting competencies, learn to leverage the Xero cloud accounting platform efficiently, and align their practices with prevailing accounting standards. 

Whether for small business management or large corporate finance, this MasterClass Xero Accounting course offers the most important and needed skills for today's digital accounting landscape.
objective:
Learners will be able to perform transactional accounting and validate the accuracy of financial information using Xero accounting software.

Through hands-on exercises and practical applications, students will develop their accounting competencies, learn to leverage the Xero cloud accounting platform efficiently, and align their practices with prevailing accounting standards.
title: Xero Accounting MasterClass

content:
With an accelerated pace of change in the financial industry, rigorous demands in regulatory compliance, increased threats faced by customers, new entrants in digital banking, and higher expectations from customers, along with long work hours, staff burnout, disengagement, and attrition, it is increasingly critical to support our people with empathy and care to create conditions for them to be at their best, thereby contributing to continued higher productivity and organization success. This is critical because:   
- Stress and burnout block creativity and productivity 
- An agile and resilient workforce seizes change as an opportunity to transform
- Leaders need to manage themselves before they can manage their teams
- Positive team culture radiates energy for the larger team to perform at their best
objective:
In this highly engaging workshop, leaders in the financial industry will help themselves and their team:
- Lead habits in teams as a vehicle for sustained care, resilience, and performance
- Design effective routines for self to consistently achieve a sense of well-being and energy
- Apply strategies to stay focused and access their best thinking despite intense stress
- Anticipate and implement mitigating actions to manage well-being at a team or organizational level
- Improve their personal branding as a calm leader across the organization, industry, and network
title: Whole Person | Whole Leader - Managing Self for a High Performing Team

content:
Affiliate marketing is a digital marketing model that connects retailers with independent sales and marketers who are willing to invest time and money to sell their products. 

Most of the available affiliate marketing models are based on performance which means that retailers only pay when the affiliate delivers a specific customer action. 

In ecommerce, it can be an online purchase which makes affiliate marketing a cost-effective way for retailers.
objective:
1. The learner will be able to examine key components of an organisation’s affiliate marketing strategies and develop an implementation plan in alignment to the organization’s overall marketing strategy.

2.The learner will be able to analyse different affiliate partners and platforms to develop an affiliate marketing portfolio for organization’s products and services. 

3.The learner will be able to examine policies and guidelines on affiliate marketing and analyse critical factors on affiliate partners selection.  

4.The learner will be able to review affiliate marketing campaign management and monitor performance metrics on ROI (Returns on Investment)
title: WSQ Affiliate Marketing Essential

The projects within the module are designed to provide learners with practical experience in creating comprehensive digital marketing campaigns. Overall, the “Capstone Project Digital Marketing” module equips learners with the practical skills and knowledge required to excel in the dynamic world of digital marketing, enabling them to create and implement effective digital marketing strategies that achieve tangible and measurable results.

content:
The age of the digital economy is upon us, for both general public and criminals alike. Our always-connected lives and our dealings with digital assets, coupled with the transnational nature of these crimes and attendant challenges in the investigative process, result in such digital crimes being a real and present threat to our daily activities. It is therefore imperative that we educate ourselves on the types of crimes that can be committed in the digital space, so that we prevent ourselves from being the victims of online scams, doxxing, phishing or hacking attempts.

This module examines the various types of offences committed in the digital space, and offers insight into the steps that have been taken to tackle this increasingly prevalent threat. Participants will also gain a deeper appreciation of the methodology, considerations and tools used to investigate and prosecute these offences, as well as understand the steps that may be taken to recover virtual property that has been removed as a consequence of a criminal offence.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: 
• Understand the different species of digital crimes 
• Understand the breadth of digital crimes covered under the Computer Misuse Act, Penal Code, Corruption, Drug Trafficking and Other Serious Crimes (Confiscation of Benefits Act), and Prevention from Harassment Act 
• Understand what digital evidence is and why computer forensics are important
• Understand the transnational implications as well as the difficulties of enforcing laws against digital crimes committed outside of Singapore 
• Understand and appreciate the process, considerations, and concerns during the investigation and prosecution of digital crimes
• Understand the considerations and potential tools to recover assets that have been moved outside of Singapore’s jurisdiction
title: Graduate Certificate in Law and Technology Module 8: Crimes of the Digital Economy

content:
IoT – An Overview: Introduction to IoT: What is IoT, and what is the state-of-the-art of the Internet of Things? Is it a fad, or has it already become a reality? What’s the forecast for IoT in the next 5 years?
 
Enabling technologies for IoT - I: What are the sensors, embedded devices and other hardware that are typically used to build IoT systems? What are the real-life implications and challenges of using these hardware? How do you interconnect IoT devices to the backend for sense-making?
 
Enabling technologies for IoT - II: Stakeholder-centric approach to identify requirements for making sense of IoT data. Discussion of common techniques, and illustrate through actual projects. Managed vs unmanaged IoT systems.
 
Opportunities and risks of IoT: Illustration of opportunities of IoT through real-life examples. Presentation of potential show-stoppers and risks through operational experiences from large-scale IoT systems.
objective: Acquire general knowledge of Internet of Things (IoT) systems and technologies, and be able to identify opportunities to create and extract value from IoT applications. Learn key considerations in the use of IoT for solving problems.
title: Internet of Things: Technology & Applications

content: CompTIA Network+ helps an IT professional to develop a career in IT infrastructure covering troubleshooting, configuring and managing networks. It is a vendor neutral networking certification that is trusted around the world. It validates the essential knowledge and skills needed to design and implement functional networks; configure, manage and maintain essential network devices; implement network security standards and protocols; troubleshoot network problems; and support the creation of virtualized networks. This course thus provides the background knowledge and skills participants will require to be a successful CompTIA Network+ certified networking professional by preparing them well enough to take the latest Exam (N10-007).
objective:
LO1: Configure switched, IP and routed networks following the prevailing network architecture approach
LO2: Monitor network performance
LO3: Determine areas for improvement to better align network performance to business needs
LO4: Optimise network rules, routing, and traffic flow to meet changing business needs
LO5: Diagnose causes for incidents of network faults or downtime
LO6: Determine corrective actions to implement to rectify faults
LO7: Support the creation of virtualised networks
title: CompTIA Network+ for IT Networking Engineers

content: The programme is designed to provide individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to manage the investment and portfolio risks associated with digital assets. The program covers various topics such as an overview of the digital asset ecosystem, investment and risk management portfolio, and regulatory compliance - overall and in the Singapore context. The programme will equip professionals in the finance, investment, legal, and blockchain industries with the necessary skills and knowledge to thrive in the digital assets ecosystem. Our program is also beneficial for individuals interested in investing in digital assets for their personal portfolios.
objective:
At the end of the course, the participants will be able to:
•	Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of the digital asset ecosystem, including the underlying technology, market trends, and potential risks and opportunities associated with investing in digital assets.
•	Develop the skills and knowledge to effectively manage the investment and portfolio risks associated with digital assets, including risk assessment, diversification strategies, and regulatory compliance requirements in Singapore and other jurisdictions.
•	Maintain awareness of trends and developments and make recommendations to improve risk management processes.
•	Apply the principles of investment and risk management to construct and manage digital asset portfolios, utilizing analytical tools and techniques to evaluate investment opportunities and make informed investment decisions that align with individual or institutional investment goals.

- Lecture on ecommerce value proposition to attain revenue growth, and cloud technology to create business agility.

4) Individual learning in setting up a Woo-Commerce WordPress ecommerce website in Amazon Web Services (AWS).

5) Distributed ledger technologies
- Lecture on the business values in the adoption of Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT).
- Individual learning in blockchain wallet installation and transactions

6) Artificial intelligence (AI) and its practical use for business growth:
- Lecture on industry adoption of AI and differentiation of commercial products with an ‘AI’ mark.
- Chatbots and other practical commercial applications.
title: Agility and Growth (Synchronous e-Learning)

content: This is a five-day course which will equip participants with knowledge to attempt the PMP® credential certification examination.  The PMP® designation is recognized worldwide as the standard of the profession, attesting to one’s core knowledge and understanding of critical Project Management concepts, principles and techniques. Certification sets Project Management Professionals apart from the crowd. This programme is designed with the objective to assist participants understand PMI’s standard for Project Management with the view to prepare the participants to sit for PMP certification exam.
objective:
•	Introduction to the overview and purpose of the PMBOK Guide®
•	Know the foundational elements of projects and the importance of project management 
•	Understand the environment in which projects operate
•	Understand the role of the project manager 
•	Understand the project management framework based on the PMBOK Guide® and understand how projects are managed
•	Familiarize with the requirements of PMP® credential examination
title: Project Management Professional (PMP) (SF)

content:
This course is a continuation of Java SE: Programming I (SF). It provides the additional key skills needed by Java programmers.
This course (Java SE: Programming II), together with Java SE: Programming I (SF) will help you prepare for Oracle Certified Professional: Java SE Developer certification.
objective:
•	Create Java applications that leverage the object-oriented features of the Java language, such as encapsulation, inheritance, and polymorphism
•	Execute a Java application from the command line
•	Create applications that use the Java Collections framework
•	Search and filter collections using Lambda Expressions
•	Implement error-handling techniques using exception handling
•	Implement input/output (I/O) functionality to read from and write to data and text files
•	Manipulate files, directories and file systems using the JDK NIO.2 specification
•	Perform multiple operations on database tables, including creating, reading, updating and deleting using both JDBC and JPA technology
•	Use Lambda Expression concurrency features
•	Apply modular programming practices and services to applications
•	Create high-performing multi-threaded applications
title: Intermediate Java Programming (SF)

content:
Learning Outcomes:
- Work with different video acquisition formats to provide an end product that meets a client or broadcaster’s needs
- Understand the project management process, workflow processes, and timelines
- Ability to deliver an Edit Decision List (EDL) and other post-production elements for various stages of post-production
- Deliver a technical edit based on standards as specified by broadcasters
- Understand and apply video processing skills to manipulate footages or video materials by adjusting video signal information
- Understand waveform and vectorscope and interpret its readings
- Understand and apply audio mastering skills to adjust audio levels that meet local and international broadcast standards
- Understand different delivery formats, as well as local and international standards requirements
objective: This course is designed to equip participants with the necessary technical knowledge related to video post-production. Participants will be introduced to the complete post-production workflow, from making video ingest considerations, audio, and video processing, to making technical decisions in video mastering for content delivery. This workshop-styled module is filled with opportunities for hands-on learning with industry-standard editing systems.

content:
Engaging display content is the first step towards a successful marketing message. The ability to create effective designs, strategise, build and display web content is the difference between long-term engagement and a fleeting view for an increasingly attention-deprived society. Learn how to strategise and create focused marketing messages tailored towards digital lead generation and revenue-generation in any e-commerce enterprise or digital-ready business. 

With the wealth of knowledge and experience from digital natives in the industry, participants will learn and develop their digital skill sets in displaying content for distribution and the subsequent conversion of potential clients into paying, satisfied customers.
objective:
At the end of the course, participants will be able to:
- Learn to captivate audience visually and communicate the right message
- Optimise content and plan for a digital channel mix
- Craft content according to different marketing purposes
- Learn to select and use various tools to help enhance creative outputs for maximum impact
- Gain practical experience through hands-on projects specially crafted for today’s digital marketer
title: Digital Marketing - Creating and Curating Display Content in Your Digital Strategy

content:
In today’s economy, it is essential that all workers are comfortable with using modern digital technology at their workplace. As digital technology transforms the workplace, workers at all levels must be able to keep themselves up-to-speed with emerging technology.
This course is a two-day fast track programme that aims to equip learners with the foundational digital skills to begin reaping the benefits of current and future technology. Learners will also be able to adopt the current mindset to take control of their own learning process so that they will be future-ready.
objective:
a.	Define the jobs and digital skills required in the current and future digital economy
b.	Apply the skills needed to work in a technology-rich environment and know the associated cybersecurity risks
c.	Identify various digital applications and tools in work applications, including widely applicable national and sectoral platforms
d.	Recognise how data and information can be used 
e.	Apply functional outcomes such as the use of digital tools and software to access various learning paths and content 
f.	Develop a post-course action plan to continue learning (i.e., to identify courses that would allow participants to further deepen their skills in the four key areas)
title: SkillsFuture for Digital Workplace 2.0 Generic (Classroom + Asynchronous E-learning)

content:
What You Will Be Learning
-What is Data Protection by Design (DPbD) - History, Concept and Application
- What is a Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIA) and how to conduct
- Importance of DPbD and DPIA in various regulations (Singapore, Philippines & EU)
- Plan and assess situations with hands-on projects for DPbD and DPIA
objective: This module provides participants with an understanding and implementation of Data Protection by Design (DPbD) and Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIA). participants will learn the key principles and implementation for Data Protection by Design in various scenarios. Using a mixture of enforcement cases and scenarios, participants will also learn to conduct Data Protection Imapct Assessments using a blended approach.
title: Advanced Certificate in Data Protection Operational Excellence Module 3: Advanced Data Protection Techniques: Data Protection by Design, DPIA & DPTM

content:
Social media advertising is one of the fastest-growing forms of digital advertising today due to its effectiveness.  This 2-day programme aims to equip marketing professionals with the right foundation, practical knowledge and hands-on practice. 

Learners will be able to plan, set up, run and optimise effective Facebook and Instagram ad campaigns in order to reach the right audiences and achieve desired marketing objectives.
objective:
● LO1 Gather feedback from relevant stakeholders to identify Facebook and Instagram campaign objectives and components of operational plans
● LO2 Develop a Facebook and Instagram marketing plan consisting of products and services to be advertised, marketing mix and campaign schedules
● LO3 Execute Facebook and Instagram marketing campaigns based on marketing strategies and plans with pre-campaign testing and analysis
● LO4 Monitor Facebook and Instagram campaign performance and effectiveness based on the target audience and competitor responses to optimise the campaign
● LO5 Analyse post-campaign data to derive learnings and recommendations for future Facebook and Instagram campaigns
title: Facebook & Instagram Advertising Mastery

content: This is a three-day course which offers the participant with comprehensive understanding of the ITIL 4 concepts, terminology and principles being applied for IT Service Management. It embraces key concepts from Lean, Agile and DevOps to provide an integrated, collaborative and holistic approach to deliver business value for an organization. After completing the course, the participant will be equipped with adequate knowledge to prepare themselves for the ITIL 4 Foundation exam.
objective:
•	Understand the ITIL Service Value System
•	Understand and describe the key concepts for creating value for services
•	Describe the Four Dimensions of Service Management
•	Understand the Service Value Chain and its activities
•	Explain the use ITIL guiding principles
•	Explain some of the key ITIL practices like Incident management, Problem management , Change control and etc.
title: ITIL®4 Foundation (SF)

content:
The course content includes:
• Quality characteristics of Western dry-heat dishes
• Recipes and methods of preparing different types of Western dry-heat dishes
• Complementary combinations of spread, filling and garnish ingredients best suited for different types of sandwiches and wraps
• Caramelisation process and importance of even caramelisation
• Various use of compound butters
• Methods of presenting finished products

This includes attaining knowledge in inspecting the quality of ingredients, mixing ingredients to achieve desired tastes and combining complementary flavours and cooking techniques in preparing different types of Western dry-heat dishes.

content: CompTIA A+ is the industry standard for establishing a career in IT. CompTIA A+ certified professionals are proven problem solvers. They support today’s core technologies from security to cloud to data management and more. It is the only industry recognized credential with performance-based items to prove pros can think on their feet to perform critical IT support tasks in the moment. It is trusted by employers around the world to identify the go-to person in end point management and technical support roles. CompTIA A+ is regularly re-invented by IT experts to ensure that it validates core skills and abilities demanded in the workplace.
objective:
LO1: Configure device hardware, operating systems, and software for diagnostic actions
LO2: Diagnose the causes of incidents and problems
LO3: Classify incidents and problems to determine impact and urgency
LO4: Resolve identified issues and problems
LO5: Devise preventive measures against similar problems
LO6: Chart specific problems for continuous containment and prevention
LO7: Develop records of problems, workarounds and solutions
title: CompTIA A+ for IT Support Professionals

content:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to:

transform idea(s) into a video

identify the stages of video production within pre-production, production and post-production

produce a video based on a script and storyboard
objective:
Have you ever tried creating your own video for Facebook or YouTube? Are you keen on understanding and developing the skills needed to create and edit your own professional-looking videos?

This entry-level course will introduce you to the main principles of digital video production. This course will teach you to apply basic videography and editing techniques to video production. Using the Plan-Do-Edit concept, you will be able to plan, execute and edit your own video production.

This course is suitable for those taking their first steps into basic video production. You will learn to understand your audience and recognise the elements of a good video. Furthermore, you will be exposed to various techniques of script writing, storyboarding, video compositions, and audio and video editing through hands-on practice and activities. You will also cover the technological aspect of video production such as the use of mobile devices, video editing tools and online animation applications for beginners.
title: Basic Video Creation and Editing

content:
•	Experience the use of latest in-demand digital tools, for example Metaverse, and Augmented Reality, Generative AI (eg. ChatGPT).
•	Apply automation (hardware and software) techniques to reduce manual intervention in daily lives, with hardware (eg. robotics, IoT, etc) and software (eg. Power Automate) experiences.

The course is divided into four domains, namely In-demand Digital Tools, Automation, Data Analytics, and Cybersecurity risks. Each domain is designed to provide participants with hands-on experience in the latest digital tools and techniques and equip them with the skills needed to thrive in today's digital world.

content: This course is designed for marketing professionals who need to oversee and manage digital marketing agencies on a day-to-day basis. The objective of this course is to allow marketing professionals to gain a broad understanding of Digital Marketing concept and methodologies, as well as key digital marketing terminologies and metrics. This course will also focus on techniques for managing marketing assets and unifying performance tracking for both online and offline channels.
objective:
• Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of integrated marketing concepts, channels, and strategies
• Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of digital marketing terminologies and metrics applicable in integrated marketing campaign management
• Develop a digital marketing strategy and set key performance indicators (KPIs) for the marketing campaign based on the organisation’s business and marketing objectives
• Calibrate the marketing campaign based on the product nature and the expected consumer behaviour based on the profiles of target customers
• Select marketing channel mix that best suits the target customers
• Develop action plan to integrate traditional and digital marketing techniques and assets
• Track and report on effectiveness of campaign, for both digital and offline channels, using a variety of analytical and modelling tools
title: Digital Marketing Management: Planning and Implementing Integrated Marketing Campaigns

content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) have significantly changed businesses and business ecosystems across almost all sectors. Especially, as disruptive technologies, AI and ML are developing new applications and increasing business performances. AI and ML can automate different business processes and use data to devise predictive systems and high-performance decision supporters. Meanwhile, hardware robots and software chatbots are going to replace human operators in many activities. This way, we can give the workforce more time for business development, troubleshooting, and creativity. Typically, the homogeneity and speed of AI/ML-driven systems would be higher. The important question to ask is how we can make our business AI/ML-ready and transform it into an intelligent business. During this course, we are going to help participants to find proper answers to those important questions.
objective:
At the end of the course, participants will be able to:

• define digitalization, digital transformation, and the intelligent transformation of businesses clearly
• understand Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) capabilities to help their business.
• Articulate different approaches and methodologies of intelligent transformation of businesses.
• Practice intelligent transformation based on some real-world scenarios.
title: Intelligent Transformation of Businesses (Synchronous e-learning)

content: This module explores digital marketing as a subset of a larger set of concepts and theories within the marketing discipline. Marketers make considerable use of interactive digital technologies: the Internet, interactive TV, social network communications, electronic kiosks, etc. They do so to achieve a variety of goals: market intelligence provision, developing new business models, building customer profiles, direct and interactive communications, placing goods with customers through virtual stores, and working with customers to develop innovative new products and services. These activities present management with exciting opportunities, reveal new sources of competition, and also demand a re-evaluation of core competencies.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Familiarise themselves with key marketing strategies in the constantly evolving digital marketing economy
• Integrate effective and efficient digital strategies into traditional marketing planning
• Understand and apply current research and trends in digital marketing
title: Advanced Certificate in Digital Transformation in Marketing Module 2: Digital Marketing Strategies (Synchronous E-learning)

objective:
The course is also known by the title ‘SkillsFuture for the Digital Workplace: Be a Part of the Future-Ready Digital Workforce’

Course Outline
This 2-day hands-on course will provide learners with the foundational skills and knowledge to perform functional tasks in the digital economy effectively and securely. Learners will be exposed to data analytics technologies, in-demand digital tools, and automation technologies that are increasingly adopted by organisations across industries, as well as the underlying cybersecurity risks in using any of them. This empowers learners with awareness of current and emerging technologies and data trends, and the mental preparedness to adjust to and anticipate digitalisation and accompanying changes at the workplace. Through the course coverage and the action plan for learning that they will set in the course, learners will gain confidence to set and follow the next steps in their learning and career pathways. 
(Laptops will be provided for use during the course, but learners are strongly encouraged to bring along a smartphone as the course covers interoperability and integration between mobile and computer.)
title: SkillsFuture Digital Workplace 2.0 (SFDW 2.0) – Built Environment

content: This course will describe how to ‘go digital’ the right way, encompassing the formulation of a basic digital strategy and applying technology in the redesigning of key work processes and the rethinking of the day-to-day management and monitoring of services. Participants will recognise how to use technology in an integrative way, rather than an add-on manner. ‘Built-In’ instead of ‘Bolted-On’. By employing these techniques and practices, participants will be able to help their respective organisations move forward in its digital transformation and reach new levels of sustainably high performance, avoiding the digital disaster ‘quick wins’ that would otherwise move the organisation backwards.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to:
• Identify key pitfalls in antiquated thinking traits and organisational management practices with respect to technological developments, societal trends and geo-economic realities
• Review the challenges towards digital transformation at the workplace
• Analyse digital transformation failures and identify areas of opportunities
• Practice how to formulate an empathy-driven customer-centric digital transformation plan 
• Distinguish new concepts of process design for the digital era where processes are designed to seamlessly flow product or service from customer needs to customer fulfilment using technologies such as Al and RPA, towards improving Customer Experience, Lead Time, Quality and Agility 
• Employ technologies such as IoT and data analytics for real time process and user behaviours tracking to improve organisational agility within the rapidly changing business environments and customer preferences
• Discuss the critical importance of employee engagement, human-centricity and change management as vital drivers for digital transformation
title: Applying Smart Tech in a Smart Way: The Right Approach to Digital Transformation

content:
This course addresses the following core areas for legal, compliance and risk practitioners within the financial services industry (including crypto and payment firms), and those who seek to understand the legal, compliance and risk implications of this emerging asset classes. 

Regulators worldwide have introduced regulatory frameworks to regulate digital assets  such as digital payment tokens, stablecoins, utility tokens, digital securities.  Based on blockchain and distributed ledger technology, new business models and players have emerged. The emerging financial landscape including decentralized finance with new digital/virtual asset classes, new business activities products and services and expanded customer segments and access present opportunities, rewards and risks with attendant legal, regulatory and compliance considerations.

Scope:  The Course sets out to provide an overview of the fintech ecosystem and its underlying technologies with a focus on digital/virtual assets classes and deepen participants’ understanding of the relevant legal, regulatory compliance and risk issues. Participants will be challenged to generate compliance solutions to address these new and emerging risks.
objective:
The Course sets out to provide an overview of the fintech ecosystem and its underlying technologies with a focus on digital/virtual assets classes and deepen participants’ understanding of the relevant legal, regulatory compliance and risk issues. Participants will be challenged to generate compliance solutions to address these new and emerging risks.

Course Learning Outcomes
By the end of this module, successful participants will be able to:
	Have an appreciation and overview of fintech activities and their enabling technologies. 

	Describe and explain supervisory expectations and approaches to regulating fintech.

	Describe and explain the different digital asset classes and players in the ecosystem.
	Understand the regulatory framework that may be applicable to different types of digital assets.
	Articulate the key legal, regulatory and compliance risks arising from digital assets.
	Propose relevant compliance solutions in relation to digital asset classes.
title: Digital Assets – Legal, Regulatory, Compliance & Risks

content:
The Specialist Diploma in Digital Content Marketing (SD-DCM) is an 18-month programme designed to deepen the skills and knowledge of participants in Digital Content Marketing, through structured institutional-based learning. 

SD-DCM is a package of modules that comprises of the modules within the Work-Study Programme in Digital Content Marketing (WSProg-DCM). On top of the five (5) modules required to fulfil the requirements of the WSProg-DCM, students taking the SD-DCM are required to take an additional module to obtain the SD-DCM
objective: The course aims were reviewed and revised to focus on two (2) course objectives, digital content strategy and digital content creation. Deepening skills in these two areas will allow our graduates to more effectively perform their key tasks and improve their employability in digital content marketing.
title: Digital Content Development

content: The learning units are sequenced from a ‘Simple to Complex’ approach starting from AutoCAD basic functions such as reading and visualizing AutoCAD technical drawings (LU1). Next, the curriculum will cover AutoCAD intermediate functions such as creating part list for new designs and the production of technical drawings and specifications. Lastly, the curriculum will cover AutoCAD advance functions such as 2D and 3D technical drawings and the development of design prototypes.
objective:
LO1. The learners will be able to interpret AutoCAD technical drawings and specifications according to briefs in relations to symbols, standards, and conventions within one’s field and region.

LO2. The learners will be able to create part lists to facilitate technical drawing based on the types and specifications.

LO3. The learners will be able to apply the concepts of information technology (IT) to facilitate the usage of technical drawing software to produce drawings and specifications that conform to the requirements of relevant standards for discipline specific uses.

LO4. The learners will be able to apply the different methods of technical drawing using instruments and digital systems to produce 2D and 3D technical drawings and specifications based on input from stakeholders.

LO5. The learners will be able to apply the fundamentals of design documentation using AutoCAD to assist in the development and construction of new designs’ prototypes.
title: Technical Drawing with AutoCAD

content: Machine learning is a branch of Artificial Intelligence that makes use of sample data known as training data to build a model for making predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed to do so. It has been applied in many applications such as email filtering, text analysis, sales forecasting, digital marketing, computer vision, healthcare, etc. where it is difficult or unfeasible to develop conventional algorithms to perform the needed tasks. In this course, participants will learn the fundamental concepts of Machine Learning. These include Supervised and Unsupervised Learning methods such as Linear Regression, Logistics Regression, Support Vector Machines, K-Nearest Neighbours, K-Means and Hierarchical Clustering. This course teaches how to use Python to create Machine Learning applications.
objective:
This course aims to:
1) Provide participants with a strong foundation in advanced analytics methods.
2) Provide participants with the necessary knowledge to appreciate the proper application of advanced analytics methods in business applications.
3) Teach participants the use of Python for creating Machine Learning applications.

At the end of the course, participants will be able to:
1) Understand various machine learning methods for classifying and clustering data.
2) Use Python to implement Machine Learning methods in business applications.
title: Machine Learning in Python

content:
CompTIA CyberSecurity Analyst (CySA+) certification is an intermediate-level certification designed to demonstrate the knowledge and competencies of a security analyst or specialist with more than three years’ experience in the fi eld. This course prepares cybersecurity analysts for the certification exam by CompTIA , which may be undertaken by the learner, on their own accord after this preparatory training program.
This course covers how to monitor and detect security incidents in information systems and networks, and execute proper responses to such incidents. The course introduces tools and tactics to manage cybersecurity risks, identify various types of common threats, evaluate the organization's security, collect and analyze cyber security intelligence, and handle incidents as they occur.
objective:
LO1: Devise threat hunting mechanisms and security incident alert triggers
LO2: Analyse threats and security incidents using various sources of information and data to determine their extent and impact
LO3: Devise appropriate containment and remediation solutions and strategies based on analyses
LO4: Direct recovery efforts after containing and remediating security incidents
LO5: Devise mitigation and prevention processes and policies
LO6: Direct implementation of mitigation and prevention processes and policies
title: CompTIA CySA+ for Cybersecurity Analysts
trainingProviderAlias: BELLS INSTITUTE OF HIGHER LEARNING PTE. LTD.

content:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to: 

• Identify the various sectors of the Semiconductor Industry ecosystem
• Describe the facilities support needed for Wafer Fabrication
• Describe the procedures for operating in cleanroom and handling hazardous chemicals
• Describe the process flow for integrated circuit (IC) manufacturing
• Describe the various processes for Wafer Fabrication
• Operate the Wafer Fabrication processes
• Apply the principles of the use of statistical process control charts for process control 
•  Identify key Industry 4.0 technologies that accelerate digital transformation of Manufacturing/Operations within the Semiconductor & Electronics Industry 
• Determine the benefits brought about by Industry 4.0 technologies to address the challenges in the Semiconductor & Electronics industry.
objective: This course provides participants with the relevant knowledge and skills of the Wafer Fabrication process in the Semiconductor Manufacturing Industry. Participants will be introduced to facilities in the manufacturing process such as cleanrooms and handling of hazardous chemicals, various stages in Semiconductor Manufacturing from front end to back end; fabless, manufacturing flow and understanding of the fabrication processes for integrated circuits (IC) and statistical process control. There will be hands-on sessions working with process equipment and metrology tools in the cleanroom. The Industry 4.0 technologies and its benefits to the Semicon Industry will also be taught in the course.
title: Wafer Fabrication in Semiconductor Industry

content:
What You'll Learn
The Specialist Diploma in Digital Content Marketing focuses on digital content strategy and digital content creation that is applied in the areas of digital content marketing. It equips participants with equivalent roles such as Marketing Executive and Community Development Executive with the knowledge and skills required to undertake new roles that include marketing and content creation in the digital industries.

Jointly offered by Singapore Polytechnic (SP) and Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS), the Specialist Diploma in Digital Content Marketing is a 12-month programme (upon approval of proposed change) designed to deepen the skills and knowledge of participants in DCM through structured institutional-based learning. Thereafter, they may continue with another one module with SUSS, while enrolled as a part-time undergraduate with SUSS, to lead to a SUSS Minor in Digital Content Marketing.
objective:
Participants will learn to:
a. Evaluate and employ diverse social media platforms for business in line with emerging trends.
b. Apply effective social media content and management strategies.
c. Measure and analyse social media content performance through analytics.
d. Develop compelling brand stories for clients and create impactful branded videos using proper techniques.
e. Conceptualise and optimise branded videos for various social media platforms.
f. Craft engaging branded content scripts, plan and execute production shoots, utilising camera, light, and audio techniques.
g. Edit videos using both traditional editing software and cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools.
h. Gain a holistic understanding of digital content marketing, leveraging content creation and AI tools for a powerful online presence.
i. Create digital content from scratch, including written and visual elements, understanding digital content formats, forms, and functions.
j. Focus on strategic social media management covering corporate communication, public relations, social media campaigns, and online reputation management.
k. Explore the impact of digital influence, assess strengths and weaknesses, and envision the future of social media in strategic communication.
title: Digital Video Content Creation

content:

- Monitoring, analytics and metrics on owned and third party websites
- Monitoring VS Social Listening
- The performance measurement and analytics framework
- Defining data strategies that are aligned to the strategic needs of the business
- Web metrics and search engine optimisation
objective: This course will delve into harvesting important data from social media platforms, strategies and campaigns. Conducting research on social media and ensuring that the data is accurate and bias-free. The power of social media platform lies in its ability to provide information that brings accuracy in targeting the audiences and customers. The course will equip participants with a pragmatic approach to define performance measurement and management strategies for a digital media product. Besides tracking, analysis and measurement techniques, the course also teaches participants the techniques in listening to online conversations; obtaining and understanding of brand sentiment while boosting visibility and accessibility to the correct set of audiences and customers.
title: Social Media - Monitoring, Metrics and Analytics (Classroom and Synchronous E-Learning)

Digital marketing advertising helps entrepreneurs and companies market their products/services online and keep the business future proof.

It is crucial the evolving digital marketing channels space for your business, and how it affects your brand.

Unlike conventional forms of marketing, the digital marketing is unique in its capacity on the scope of your marketing reach
and the laser focus of your target audience. 

Using digital marketing channel, your business can transcend from traditional constraints such as geography and time zones to connect with a wider audience and more cost effective.

content:
Video content has permeated every aspect of our lives. We begin to realise its impact on our daily lives in terms of information dissemination and how we make decisions. It is therefore paramount to understand and leverage the power of distribution tools such as Facebook, YouTube and Vimeo, and how videos can be a powerful tool for successful digital marketing campaigns.

Learn the art of delivering relevant content while driving profitable actions, as such a crucial skill becomes imperative to any industry. Participants will learn the building blocks of creating video content and equip themselves with the skill of crafting the right content tailored to their audience's needs.
objective:
At the end of the course, participants will be able to:
- Understand various digital content strategies and the use of storytelling to script
- How to select and use various video production tools to help enhance your creative output for maximum digital impact
- Gain practical experience through a hands-on, real-life project specially created for today’s digital marketer
title: Digital Marketing - Creating and Curating Video Content in Your Digital Strategy

content: The Smart Nation initiative, integral to Singapore’s next phase of nation building endeavours to transform Singapore through technology bringing about pervasive digitalisation. It aims to address national challenges and drive digital transformation in key domains such as health, education, transport, urban solutions and finance. As part of this initiative, Singapore has laid out mutually reinforcing plans to build a Digital Economy, Digital Government and Digital Society. This will mean a whole-of-nation effort to adopt digital technologies, making going digital a national imperative.
objective: Upon completing the course, the graduates will be digitally conversant to contribute effectively to a smart and connected workplace, equipped with skills and techniques essential for them to apply smart technologies to their domains, manage and analyse data for the system to gain value through informed intelligent decisions to enhance performance and productivity.
title: Post-Diploma Certificate in Smart Technology (in Specialist Diploma in Industrial Informatics)

It will also allow the learners to be able to have an insight on the impact of digital solutions for the food and beverage industry. At the end of the course, learners will be able to propose a suitable digital solution that meets the company's business activities.

In this module, students will get an overview of the Digital Product Management Framework, which comprises the Product Strategy and Leadership, and the Product Management Process Groups.

content:
- Literacy in Metaverse Tools & Concepts: Familiarity with digital tools and concepts relevant to the Metaverse, such as decentralisation and blockchain, the evolution of entertainment and economic opportunities made available due to the advancements in Metaverse

- Navigating and Exploring the Metaverse: Dive deeper into the functions available in The Sandbox and customise your own avatar to create a virtual version of yourself in Metaverse

- Application of Metaverse in Local & Overseas Communities: Discover the importance of collaboration and interaction within the Metaverse, and how local or overseas businesses are leveraging on Metaverse for customer outreach and retention

- Exploring Monetisation Opportunities: Discover potential ways to earn within the metaverse, through playing games, creating and selling virtual assets, or participating in the growing metaverse economy
objective:
- Expansion of Metaverse Knowledge: Gain understanding of what the Metaverse is and how its core technologies (e.g. Virtual Reality (VR), Augmented Reality (AR), Blockchain etc.) can be applied across various industries

- Familiarisation of Key Players and Platforms: Learn more about major Metaverse platforms such as The Sandbox, Roblox, Decentraland, Meta, Fortnite and how they are utilised by industry leaders

- Decentralisation and Web3 Concepts: Explore the role of blockchain and cryptocurrencies in the Metaverse, including concepts like non-fungible token (NFTs) and the potential for a decentralised virtual economy

- Metaverse and its Impact on the Economy: Learn about potential revenue streams within the Metaverse, such as virtual land ownership, NFT Marketplaces and building Metaverse experiences for brands
title: Introduction to Metaverse

content:
This course aims to equip supervisors and managers in food establishments with the application, skills and knowledge to conduct food safety and hygiene checks 

Learners will learn about food safety practices and regulatory requirements, pre-requisite programmes implemented in food establishments, methods used to conduct food safety and hygiene inspection/check, food safety and hygiene lapses and corrective actions, and concepts and principles of Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP)
objective:
At the end of the 3-day course, learners will be able to :

- Conduct food safety and hygiene checks on personal hygiene practices, usage of safe ingredients, safe handling of food, food storage, equipment and cleanliness of entire premises to identify hygiene lapses and manage non-conformance

-Understand concepts and principles of Pre-Requisite Programs and Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point (HACCP) system 

-Implement food safety and hygiene inspection policies and procedures, manage and address nonconformance issues through effective implementation of pre-requisite programmes and HACCP-based Food Safety Management System (FSMS)
title: Food Safety Course Level 3 (Chinese)

content: CompTlA Security+ is a global certification that validates the skills necessary to perform core security functions and pursue an IT security career. CompTlA Security+ establishes the core knowledge required of any cybersecurity role and provides a springboard to intermediate-level cybers ecurity jobs. It is chosen by more corporations and defense organizations than any other certification on the market to validate baseline security skills and for fulfilling the DoD 8570 compliance. It covers the most core technical skills in risk assessment and management, incident respons e, forensics, enterprise networks, hybrid/cloud operations, and security controls, ensuring high-performance on the job. This course thus provide s the background knowledge and skills participants will require to be a successful CompTlA Security+ certified cybersecurity professional while also preparing them well enough to take the latest CompTlA Security+ Exam (SY0-601).
objective:
LO1 : Determine specific threats to network security in an organisation 
LO2: Assess the security posture of an enterprise environment
LO3: Devise preventive security measures for different network components
L04: Develop a robust auditing and incident response plan
LO5: Develop network security risk management plan
LO6: Apply optimisations to configurations aligned with the incident response plan
L07: Implement risk management and incident response plan
title: CompTlA Security+ for Cybersecurity Professionals

content: This workshop is designed to help people boost their productivity using AI tools like ChatGPT. Attendees will learn about the latest AI tools and how they can be used to automate repetitive tasks and free up time for more meaningful work in their businesses or day-to-day lives. The workshop will feature hands-on exercises and real-world use cases to illustrate the practical applications of AI in boosting productivity. The workshop will also discuss potential pitfalls when using these solutions so that participants can make informed decisions about whether they are suitable for them. By the end of this workshop, attendees should have a better understanding of how they can leverage AI tools to increase their productivity and get more done with less effort, which is ideal for professionals looking to enhance their skills and gain a competitive edge in the rapidly evolving digital landscape.
objective:
By the end of the course, participants will be able to:
-	Learn about the various Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools available, their advantages and disadvantages, and how to implement them into businesses or day-to-day lives for better efficiency.
-	Understand how and what AI tools can help automate mundane or repetitive tasks with minimal effort and free up time for more important work.
-	Use popular AI tools to improve productivity.
-	Integrate AI tools for lasting improvements in productivity, organisation and overall workflows.
-	Learn practical tips on implementing AI in businesses or day-to-day lives for greater efficiency and effectiveness.
-	Become familiar with potential pitfalls when using these technologies and services.
title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) for Boosting Productivity

content:
Individual Interest
Puts in safeguards to protect individuals’ data from misuse by regulating proper management of personal data.
Gives individuals greater control over their personal data.
To strengthen consumer trust that their personal data will be used responsibly.

Economic Interest 
Strengthens Singapore’s position as trusted hub and choice location for data hosting and processing activities thereby enhancing Singapore’s overall competitiveness.
Greater interoperability with global frameworks to enhance ease of doing business and cross-border data flows.
To enable organisations to confidently harness personal data for innovation, which would in turn benefit citizens and the economy.
Approach for the Data Protection Regime 

Approach for the Data Protection Regime 
Enhance consumer protection to support trust and participation in digital economy
Enable organisations to harness data confidently to innovate and improve consumer products and services
Harness personal data for legitimate business purposes, with the requisite safeguards and accountability
objective:
At the end of this chapter, participants will be able to have an overview of the PDPA, understand the key terms and the level of impact to organisations.
Objectives of the Data Protection Regime 
Key Terms – Personal Data, Business Contact Information (BCI), Individual & Organisations, Data Intermediary and Other Key Terms
Who Will Not be Impacted? 
Introduction to Data Protection Frameworks Around the World

The fundamentals of marketing and advertising have gone beyond the traditional print and mainstream media. The digital world has infiltrated our lives and understanding digital marketing is vital to businesses.

content:
Upon completion of this course, trainees should be able to:
●	Acquire a holistic understanding of computer hardware, encompassing its definition, significance, identification of core components, and their pivotal role in facilitating user-computer interactions.
●	Attain a comprehensive understanding of computer hardware, encompassing the primary roles of essential components like the motherboard, CPU, RAM, and storage devices, as well as familiarity with a variety of user interaction tools and the foundational mechanisms of data transfer via ports and cables.
●	Build capabilities for assembling and upgrading a PC, discerning component compatibility during upgrades, and effectively troubleshooting prevalent challenges that arise during the PC building process.
●	Articulate the role of BIOS in the boot process, optimise BIOS settings for enhanced system performance, and proficiently diagnose and resolve boot-related issues and errors.
objective: The Understanding Computer Hardware & Peripherals course offers participants a deep insight into the backbone of computing that focuses on the essentials. The curriculum introduces trainees to the integral components of a computer, how they connect and interact, and the practical skills required for building or upgrading a PC. The course also delves into the foundational BIOS process, guiding participants through the sequence of booting a computer. It is designed to instill both theoretical knowledge and hands-on experience to ensure trainees are well-equipped to comprehend, identify, and work with various computer hardware and peripherals.
title: Understanding Computer Hardware & Peripherals

content:
The CompTIA® Network+® (SF) prepare a learner for an entry level computer networking job role. This course builds on your existing user-level knowledge and experience with personal computer operating systems and networks to present the fundamental skills and concepts that you will need to use on the job in any type of networking career. If you are pursuing a CompTIA technical certification path, the CompTIA® A+® certification is an excellent first step to take before preparing for the CompTIA® Network+® certification.
The CompTIA® Network+® (SF) that cover exam requirements of CompTIA® Network+® can benefit you in two ways. It can assist you if you are preparing to take the CompTIA Network+ examination. Also, if your job duties include network troubleshooting, installation, or maintenance, or if you are preparing for any type of network related career, it provides the background knowledge and skills you will require to be successful.
objective:
● Identify OSI layers, network models and topologies.
● Identify cables and connectors, IP addressing, ports, protocols and network services.
● Network architecture and cloud concepts.
● Network devices and their placements, deploying switches, routers and wireless technologies.
● Use appropriate documentation and diagrams to manage the network, optimizingnetwork performance and ensuring business continuity.
● Analyze the various types of security controls.
● Evaluate and use the appropriate steps and tools to identify and thus recover from network issues.
title: CompTIA Network+ (SF)

content: This course helps learners understand how businesses can best take advantage of opportunities afforded by the Metaverse, which is made up of both the physical world and its Digital Twin. By giving an overview of how each different world (Physical and Digital) contributes to the creation, sustenance and operation of the Metaverse, business owners can better plan and prepare their existing business operations to gain a first-mover advantage in this new domain.
objective:
By the end of this course, learners should be able to:
1. Understand how the physical world and its Digital Twin form two inter-related halves of the Metaverse, and why businesses must consider both halves in their business plans.
2. Analyze business problems and opportunities brought about by the Physical and Digital Twins.
3. Craft business plans within the political, economic, social and technological considerations and constraints surrounding the Physical and Digital Twins.
title: Two halves of the Metaverse: Physical and Digital Twins

content:
New digital technology has impacted and influenced the practice and development of traditional business operations. One of the most affected areas has been in the ways that marketing is now being conducted. Internet and digital technology have not only changed the ways marketing is conducted, and it has also expanded the audience as well as provided a viable platform for non-traditional marketers to be involved in the consumption, development, and production of marketing materials. 
Today, digital marketing is an integral part of any integrated marketing plan and the planned consumption of digital marketing and materials can not be left to chance. Digital marketers and consumers range from the big corporates to the teenager who is practicing her tik tok dance moves at home. 
This 24 hrs competency based assessment course aims to provide learners with an introductory insight into the new world of Digital Marketing. 

The course will provide learners with a stepping-stone into the new world of integrated marketing encompassing traditional branding, communications and marketing concepts and how they have been embraced by advents in digital technology resulting in a completely new marketing landscape. Starting with the use of mobile technology like smart phones to the intricacies of social media marketing, the learner will be introduced to the world of digital technology and how they can leverage on the new technologies to expand their reach as well as manage their brand. 

Target Sector(s):
•	Home-Bakers
•	Professional Bakers and Bakery Owners
•	Small Business Owners
objective:
Learning Outcomes
LO 1: The learner is able to identify advantages, constraints and interactivity of various marketing channels, technologies, and tools

LO 2: The learner is able to identify the key elements and considerations in a marketing mix

LO 3 : The learner is able to determine key elements of a marketing strategy based on organisational requirements and use them to create marketing objectives for various marketing channels

LO 4: The learner is able to determine the suitability of the different digital marketing channels, platforms, technologies and tools for the marketing activities proposed in the marketing objective

LO 5: The learner is able to identify the various performance indicators of each digital marketing channel.

LO 6: The learner is able to identify the impact of different digital marketing platforms and their suitability for various products and services.

LO 7: The learner is able to identify digital marketing programs that are best suited for the business product/service offering

LO 8: The learner is able to select marketing channels, and define a marketing plan for those channels for an integrated marketing campaign

LO 9: The learner is able to recommend steps to integrate traditional and digital marketing efforts for the establishment of an online presence

LO 10: The learner is able to evaluate customer response and sales performance to determine the effectiveness of each marketing channel 

LO 11: The learner is able to monitor and determine the impact of the marketing channel mix against overall sales performance

LO 12: The learner is able to apply techniques to measure the impact of a chosen marketing channel mix against the business performance
title: Integrated Digital Marketing Campaigns (IDMC)

content: This course is an executive primer on digital marketing for entrepreneurs. It prepares students with a foundational understanding of marketing in the digital age. Students will learn how marketing concepts, market analysis and consumers’ behaviour are impacted by the shifting technology and media landscape. The course will cover fundamental concepts in branding, search engine, social media, storytelling, display, re-targeting and related areas. Case studies and hands-on experience will be provided. At the end of the course, students will be better equipped to deliver coherent digital marketing strategies for their ventures.

content: SME Leaders can transform their business by utilising digital tools to drive growth. They will devise action plans to digitalise their business in line with business objectives and promote a strong digital culture within their organisation.
objective: SME Leaders can transform their business by utilising digital tools to drive growth. They will devise action plans to digitalise their business in line with business objectives and promote a strong digital culture within their organisation.
title: Enterprise Leadership for Transformation: Module 9 -  How to lead in the digital Transformation?

content: This course is designed for marketing professionals who need to oversee and manage digital marketing agencies on a day-to-day basis. The objective of this course is to allow marketing professionals to gain a broad understanding of Digital Marketing concept and methodologies, as well as key digital marketing terminologies and metrics. This course will also focus on techniques for managing marketing assets and unifying performance tracking for both online and offline channels.
objective:
At the end of the course, participants should be able to:

•	LO1. Explain integrated marketing concepts, channels, and strategies
•	LO2. Explain digital marketing terminologies and metrics applicable in integrated marketing campaign management
•	LO3. Develop a digital marketing strategy and set key performance indicators (KPIs) for the marketing campaign based on the organisation’s business and marketing objectives
•	LO4. Calibrate the marketing campaign based on the product nature and the expected consumer behaviour based on the profiles of target customers
•	LO5. Select marketing channel mix that best suits the target customers
•	LO6. Develop action plan to integrate traditional and digital marketing techniques and assets
•	LO7. Track and report on effectiveness of campaign, for both digital and offline channels, using a variety of analytical and modelling tools
title: Digital Marketing Management: Planning and Implementing Integrated Marketing Campaigns (Synchronous e-learning)

content: With immense technological advancement and an increasingly disruptive operating environment, organizations need to continue to develop its technological and business strategies so as to anticipate and respond to rapidly changing conditions. To enjoy sustained success, organisations and teams require leaders who can conduct in-depth business environment analysis, and develop an agile mindset to lead in an increasingly complex digital workplace. The programme will enable learners to appreciate the importance of leadership agility and to lead effectively in the disruptive digital economy. Through an established framework, learners will examine their current level of leadership agility and develop it further to enhance their leadership effectiveness.
objective:
At the end of this course, participants will be able to:
• Discuss the trends, opportunities and challenges in the digital age
• Appreciate the importance of leadership agility and its impact on business
• Develop leadership agility to lead effectively
• Define team and organisation agility for business success
• Build agility into the organisation through digital product innovation
• Understand how to more effectively adopt digital technologies and innovate their use
title: Leadership Agility In The Digital Economy

content: This course trains participants to be conversant with the execution stage of digital software product management projects. It teaches participants how to manage requirements, evaluate and address business environment changes, change management, and team management.
objective:

- Models, Tools, and Templates Used in Digital Software Product Management

content: As businesses increasingly invest their resources and budget in digital media, it is important to have a strong understanding of data and insights to the communication campaigns. This module introduces students to various digital media analytical tools and how to uncover and organize trends and patterns for the purpose of gaining insights for business planning and decision-making for communication strategies and business operations.
objective: The topics covered include introduction to various digital media analytical tools and their purposes, extrapolation and analysing data from various sources, evaluation of sentiment analytics; and decision-making from analytics, such as selecting KPIs and targets for campaigns and business operations, arranging monitoring effectiveness of communication strategies and follow-up actions, as well as assessing long-term targets and actions.

Using a case study approach, participants will acquire the knowledge and skills needed to seamlessly integrate these digital approaches into their client engagement and investment advisory processes, ensuring they remain both relevant and effective in an evolving financial landscape.
objective: This module examines how digital technology can create meaningful touchpoints and how AI and data provides new business and HNW client insights. content:
The Post-Diploma Certificate in Creative Content Creation (PDC1 of Specialist Diploma in Digital Content Creation for E-Commerce) covers the following modules:

• Web Analytics - 45 hours
• UX/UI Design - 45 hours
• Content Creation Design - 60 hours
objective:
The Post-Diploma Certificate in Creative Content Creation (PDC1 of Specialist Diploma in Digital Content Creation for E-Commerce) aims to train the learners on the following:

1. Analytics measurement plan for stake holders by applying the fundamentals of web analytics and trend forecasting to support digital content creation for E-Commerce environments. Including content planning and strategy, measuring of the effectiveness of marketing channels and the making of informed business decisions in digital content creation.
2. User experience design techniques (UX) to create content for a brand’s designated audience and apply sense-making skills into content-focused design and easy user interfaces (UI). Learners will be able to apply empathy techniques to better understand users and improve customer satisfaction with digital interfaces that are easy to use and a delight to interact with.
3. Dynamic and engaging digital content that is in line with an organization’s art direction for the e-commerce environment. Learners will be able to demonstrate stakeholder management, business presentation delivery and design writing skills and the ability to communicate with both internal and external stakeholders.
title: Post-Diploma Certificate in Creative Content Creation (part of Specialist Diploma in Digital Content Creation for E-Commerce)

content:

The course also includes planning product roadmaps across different products or regions. Learners will develop strategies for digital marketing by analyzing customer segments, identifying market gaps, and assessing competitive forces to select the most effective approach at the corporate level."

content: While there are many new web development frameworks, Hypertext Markup Language (HTML) and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) remain the two most essential building blocks of web development. This course is meticulously crafted to provide aspiring web developers, designers, entrepreneurs, and enthusiasts with a deep understanding of the foundations of web development, empowering them to build professional-looking websites. Through a hands-on and interactive learning approach, participants will delve into the fundamental concepts of HTML and gain proficiency in creating well-structured websites. They will also explore the power of CSS, learning how to control the layout, appearance, and interactivity of web pages. By the end of this course, participants will have honed their skills and gained the confidence to pursue further advanced web development topics, setting them on the path to becoming proficient and sought-after web developers in today’s digital landscape.
objective:
At the end of the course, the participants will be able to:
•	Understand the basics of HTML: they will learn the fundamental structure of HTML documents, including tags, elements, and attributes
•	Understand the basics of CSS: CSS syntax, selectors, and properties to control the layout, colours, typography and overall presentation of web pages
•	Learn the skillsets to build professional-looking websites: responsive design and use of templates. 
•	Build the confidence and ability to build a website from scratch
•	Develop the foundation skills needed for advanced web development which will eventually allow them to become competent and skillful web developers
title: Foundations in Web Development using HTML and CSS (Synchronous e-learning)

content:

content: At the end of the course, Learners will be able to Identify key issues in problem situations to clearly articulate the problems at hand and propose contingency plans to resolve issues
objective:

•	Sources from which symptoms of potential problems may be identified

•	Ways to identify impact of a problem on one’s job responsibilities and other parties involved
•	Procedure for evaluating selected ideas for problem-solving
•	Factors to consider in selecting suitable modes of communication
•	Methods to determine the strengths and limitations or constraints of each selected idea
•	Areas of impact from implementation of an action plan 
•	Types of corrective actions
•	Reflective mechanisms for the entire problem-solving process

Learners will be able to demonstrate and carry out how to: (Abilities)

•	Identify symptoms that could lead to potential problem at the workplace
•	Articulate problems in a clear and concise manner
•	Provide recommendations to resolve the issues at hand
•	Apply logical deduction to anticipate and detect problems at the workplace
•	Analyse relevant information surrounding the perceived problems
•	Identify the exact problem using elimination process, objective reasoning or process questioning
•	Analyse the root causes of the problems at the workplace using appropriate problem-solving tools and techniques
•	Evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions and implementation plans by analysing feedback gathered from relevant sources

content:

●	recognising the software requirements to create a simple website

●	creating simple WordPress pages (Home, About, Contact, etc.), landing pages with call to actions using drag and drop page builders, and organising them into a main website navigation menu 
●	creating WordPress posts and organising them into a blogroll 
●	boosting website security, backup, and updating a WordPress website 
●	producing a basic WordPress design documentation for website managers
objective: WordPress is a popular platform that allows individuals and businesses to create and manage their websites without advanced technical skills. The learning content of this course includes a range of WordPress tools and plugins that enhance the website's functionality and appearance, which enable trainees to design and develop a professional and functional website using WordPress from start to finish. The applied learning approach is used throughout the course to facilitate the learning of website planning, website hosting, website design, website development, website customisation, website security, website optimisation, website maintenance, and website troubleshooting.
title: WSQ WordPress Website Creation

content:
This one (1)-year Diploma (Conversion), launched in Oct 2018, comprises two (2) Post Diploma Certificates (PDC) with a total of two hundred and seventy (270) curriculum hours conducted over two (2) semesters.

The course aims to provide students with knowledge and skills on foundational, digital and innovation elements in logistics and supply chain management (LSCM), to better prepare them for the demands of the dynamic global supply chain industry and profession. 

The target audience consists primarily of working adults who are diploma graduates as well as other graduates who are considering LSCM as a career choice.

Since the 1980s, the School of Business (SB) has offered logistics and supply chain management modules as one of the specialisation tracks under its Diploma in Business Administration (DBA) programme. This programme is in line with SP’s mission to offer CET courses to upskill working adults’ knowledge and skills to value-add to the profession and industry.
objective:
NVSCI equips students with skills such as Analytics and Automation coupled with Lean Management and Design Thinking to drive innovation in LSCM. The course is aligned to the Logistics Skills Framework’s Technical Skills and Competency (TSC).

The course is intended to fulfil the aspirations of the working adults to acquire LSCM knowledge and skills either to prepare them for additional responsibilities in their existing jobs or to enhance their job mobility when seeking new opportunities in LSCM.
title: Certificate in Supply Chain Innovation
