content:
Attitude towards Time
•	How different people look at time and what are the implications of this?
•	What mental techniques can you use to increase your productivity?
•	What is the impact of perfectionism on your productivity and how can you manage it?
•	What stops you from starting a task and how can you overcome it?
•	What techniques can you use to avoid procrastination?
•	How to take advantage of "dead time"?
•	How to free your mind from thinking continuously about critical tasks?
•	How can you optimize your day based on your capabilities and your workload?
Planning
•	How to set goals systematically to maximize your productivity?
•	How to set your mission statement based on everything you do in life?
•	Which planning style is better?
•	How to brainstorm?
•	How to plan if you don’t like planning?
•	What is a bottom-up and top-down approach to productivity?
•	What is the best way to plan in meetings to make the best use of time and produce a good plan? 
Organizing
•	How to organize your physical and digital environments?
•	What reference system works best and what its critical qualities?
•	What tray system works best?
•	What calendar system works best?
•	How to take advantage of GTD principles (Getting Things Done) to organize your life?
•	How to set up and use your calendar using the latest methodologies such as GTD?
•	How to prioritize your tasks based on urgency and importance?
•	How to use GTD with Microsoft Outlook?
Dealing with People
•	How to say “No” and be loved for it?
•	How many different ways to say "No" and what are advantages and disadvantages of each type?
•	How to deal with interruptions politely and stay in control?
•	How to delegate to increase your productivity?
•	How many different ways can you delegate and when should you use each style?
•	How to handle phone interruptions?
•	How to "engineer" your environment to minimize interruptions?
objective:
•	Control your thoughts with the right attitude so that you maximise your time efficiency
•	Plan efficiently for your goals and your mission
•	Organize your life efficiently and free your mind of little tasks
•	Respond to an interruption confidently and get maximum results
•	Say No and be lover for it!
•	Delegate tasks at the appropriate level and maximise your efficiency
title: Time Management

content:
Do you want to communicate on your sustainability efforts but are struggling with how to make it authentic and impactful? 

In this two-day course, you will learn and appreciate the role of communications in pushing and supporting a company’s sustainability strategy. You will also learn the key considerations to be put in when coming up with a sustainability communications strategy. In addition, you will also learn that sustainability communications strategy, like any other strategy, has to start with a data-driven understanding of the target audience (stakeholders). With that intimate knowledge of the target audience and the environment that the business operates in, you would learn how to apply these insights to come up with messages and stories that resonate. You will also find out how to put together the right mix of communication channels in order to amplify your messages.
objective:
Upon successful completion of this two-day course, participants will be able to:

• Outline the importance of communicating about sustainability to your stakeholders
• Identify the considerations to use to come up with a sustainability communications strategy and plan
• Identify the tools and platforms you can use to communicate to your stakeholders
• Identify content areas on sustainability that you can weave stories to tell to your stakeholders
• Create authentic and impactful stories on sustainability to communicate to your stakeholders
• Identify ways to employ traditional and digital media to amplify your sustainability messages to your stakeholders     

Coverage
1. Introduction to Sustainability Communications
2. Planning for Sustainability Communications
3. Storytelling in Sustainability
4. Amplifying your Messages with Public Relations and Marketing Communications
5. Monitoring and Tracking Progress
title: Communicating Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) and Sustainability

content: This career transition programme covers a full range of highly desired topics in cognitive skills, leadership and management skills and technical skills for the Built Environment sector. Trainees will have a great opportunity to interact with industry practitioners and leverage on their practical experience in the Built Environment sector. The modules consists of: Design Thinking, Data Analytics, Systems Thinking, Project Management, Navigating Transitions at Work, Role of the Sustainability Manager, Stakeholder Engagement and Management, Sustainability Frameworks and Certifications, Business Model Innovation, Digital Technologies for Sustainability, Circular Economy, Waste Management and a Capstone Project.
objective: This career transition programme is designed to equip trainees with the professional skills and knowledge to fulfil Managerial roles in the area of Sustainability Management in the Built Environment sector. This programme will be developing both the interpersonal and behavioural skills, and imparting highly desirable technical skillsets such as Sustainability reporting, assessment and business model innovation to the trainees. A combination of classroom/virtual training modules and capstone project will prepare trainees for a career transition into the Built Environment sector.

They will also learn how to utilise the different platforms to express themselves. This will be a hybrid course which combines offline and online learning methods to equip seniors with digital skills and to encourage them to be active in the community via digital platforms.

content:
The Specialist Diploma in Digital Content Marketing focuses on digital content strategy and digital content creation that is applied in the areas of digital content marketing. It equips participants with equivalent roles such as Marketing Executive and Community Development Executive with the knowledge and skills required to undertake new roles that include marketing and content creation in the digital industries.

Jointly offered by Singapore Polytechnic (SP) and Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS), the Specialist Diploma in Digital Content Marketing is a 12-month programme (upon approval of proposed change) designed to deepen the skills and knowledge of participants in DCM through structured institutional-based learning. Thereafter, they may continue with another one module with SUSS, while enrolled as a part-time undergraduate with SUSS, to lead to a SUSS Minor in Digital Content Marketing.
objective:
Participants will learn to:
a.	Evaluate and employ diverse social media platforms for business in line with emerging trends.
b.	Apply effective social media content and management strategies.
c.	Measure and analyse social media content performance through analytics.
d.	Develop compelling brand stories for clients and create impactful branded videos using proper techniques.
e.	Conceptualise and optimise branded videos for various social media platforms.
f.	Craft engaging branded content scripts, plan and execute production shoots, utilising camera, light, and audio techniques.
g.	Edit videos using both traditional editing software and cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools.
h.	Gain a holistic understanding of digital content marketing, leveraging content creation and AI tools for a powerful online presence.
i.	Create digital content from scratch, including written and visual elements, understanding digital content formats, forms, and functions.
j.	Focus on strategic social media management covering corporate communication, public relations, social media campaigns, and online reputation management.
k.	Explore the impact of digital influence, assess strengths and weaknesses, and envision the future of social media in strategic communication.
title: Social Media Creation & Management

content: The Smart Nation initiative, integral to Singapore’s next phase of nation building endeavours to transform Singapore through technology bringing about pervasive digitalisation. It aims to address national challenges and drive digital transformation in key domains such as health, education, transport, urban solutions and finance. As part of this initiative, Singapore has laid out mutually reinforcing plans to build a Digital Economy, Digital Government and Digital Society. This will mean a whole-of-nation effort to adopt digital technologies, making going digital a national imperative.
objective: Upon completing the course, the graduates will be digitally conversant to contribute effectively to a smart and connected workplace, equipped with skills and techniques essential for them to apply smart technologies to their domains, manage and analyse data for the system to gain value through informed intelligent decisions to enhance performance and productivity.
title: Post-Diploma Certificate in Manufacturing Analytics (in Specialist Diploma in Industrial Informatics)

content: This certificate aims to guide beginners to build up a strong foundation and understanding in digital photography; achieving a good eye in photography aesthetics using various subjects, for example, Land/Cityscape, Architecture, Street and Travel. Learners will gain knowledge and skills to produce high quality and professional photographic images through a combination of technical and aesthetic applications. They will also be introduced to basic digital imaging techniques to photo-enhance their digital images. Learners will be guided throughout the entire module and during project execution.
objective: This certificate aims to guide beginners to build up a strong foundation and understanding in digital photography; achieving a good eye in photography aesthetics using various subjects, for example, Land/Cityscape, Architecture, Street and Travel. Learners will gain knowledge and skills to produce high quality and professional photographic images through a combination of technical and aesthetic applications. They will also be introduced to basic digital imaging techniques to photo-enhance their digital images. Learners will be guided throughout the entire module and during project execution.
title: Certificate in Photography

content: This short course introduces Blender’s Digital Sculpting foundational workflows and tools, as used by 3D Artists in digital entertainment. In addition, we will explore the latest sculpting trends such as the real-time cloth simulation brushes and the innovative bones-based rigging brush to pose your creations.
objective: Participants will learn the fundamentals of digital sculpting in Blender, exploring disciplines like 3D character design, sculpting, retopology, cloth simulation, and character posing. This will provide a good base upon which they can further develop their 3D sculpting skills.
title: Digital Sculpting in Blender

content:
Millions of businesses, large and small, rely on Google Analytics to understand customer preferences and create better experiences for them. With more commerce moving online and businesses under increased pressure to make every marketing dollar count, insights from digital analytics tools are even more critical. 

The new approach also makes it possible to address long time advertiser requests. Because the new Analytics can measure app and web interactions together, it can include conversions from YouTube engaged views that occur in-app and on the web in reports. Seeing conversions from YouTube video views alongside conversions from Google and non-Google paid channels, and organic channels like Google Search, social, and email, helps you understand the combined impact of all your marketing efforts.

From the feedback of marketers who use Google Analytics, the latest Google Analytics has many new features. Google has add in new capabilities many marketers need, such as fully revamping their existing Analytics setup and encouraging marketers to create a new Google Analytics 4 property (previously called an App + Web property) alongside their existing properties. This will allow marketers to start gathering data and benefit from the latest innovations as they become available while keeping existing implementation intact.

This 16 hrs competency based assessment course aims to provide learners the skills to do Digital Analytics with Google Analytics
objective:
This course objective is to teach marketers digital analytics using the marketing analysis platform Google Analytics

Learning Outcome 1: The learner is able to define questions, trends and challenges through market research and analytics for web and mobile analytics

Learning Outcome 2: The learner is able to identify new and emerging technologies, trends and techniques for market research and customer data analytics for web and mobile analytics

Learning Outcome 3: The learner is able to describe the techniques for measuring Return on Investment(ROI), user behaviour and marketing attribution for web, mobile and digital interaction analytics

Learning Outcome 4: The learner is able to explain the principles of digital data optimisation for user demographics, behaviour and transactional data for web, mobile and digital interaction analytics

Learning Outcome 5: The learner is able to calculate ROI, marketing attribution and overall marketing effectiveness using marketing and business metrics for web, mobile and digital interaction analytics

Learning Outcome 6: The learner is able to develop new ways to organise and optimise digital data for web, mobile and digital interaction analytics

Learning Outcome 7: The learner is able to present to higher management using dark data to create key business and consumer intelligence insight and to give recommendations for web, mobile and digital interaction analytics
title: Digital Analytics with Google Analytics (DAGA)

objective: This module aims to equip participants with the knowledge and skills needed to navigate the incumbent business in the age of digital disruption, and effectively leverage digital enablers in their business transformation, and appreciate the internal challenges and put in place the correct strategy, organisation, resources and cultural shifts to address them.
title: Graduate Certificate in Strategic Digital Transformation in Finance Module 1: Digital Strategy for Finance Managers

content:
- Acquire Digital Growth Mindset and Familiarize with Industry 4.0 and the Digital Technologies.

- Learn about Market scanning and research techniques for emerging technologies relevant to your industry that you can leverage. 

- Apply these technologies to your workplace.

- Understand how Digital LEAN can address DOWNTIME wastes to increase productivity, revenue and reduce costs. 

- Design a Digital Strategy Canvas Map to kick off planning for Digital Transformation.
objective:
Explore development in other industry sectors
- Technologies or IT processes in use and under development in other industry sectors.

Review and research on new emerging technologies
- Research on new Industry 4.0 technologies.
- Market scanning and research techniques for emerging technologies.

Emerging technologies to address challenges
- Emerging technologies to address challenges or enhance processes within the organization.
- Similar or relevant industries.

Evaluate the use of different types of emerging technology platforms

- New technologies and IT products and services in the market.

Evaluate emerging technology process improvement and flows  
- Technology that offer process improvement.
- Typical business process flows.
title: Digital Transformation - Emerging Technology Synthesis

content:
The legal industry is undergoing profound changes, as the digital revolution takes its course. New technologies and innovative business models challenge the established position legal professionals have retained for centuries as sophisticated, high-earning advisors to every significant business transaction. With the advent of blockchain technology, business transactions of all kinds will experience a significant evolutionary step towards automation.

This module teaches participants the basics of blockchain, cryptocurrencies and smart contracts. To combine both legal and smart agreements in one cohesive process will be another focus of the course. The techniques taught allow legal professionals to combine their unique domain knowledge with real-world smart contract agreements, offering their clients the best of both worlds.
objective:
At the end of the 2-day module, participants will be able to: 
• Understand how blockchain works in the context of smart contracts
• Learn about the advantages and limitations of blockchain technology and appropriate use cases
• Understand the legal and regulatory environments that are in scope for smart contracts
• Understand the inherent legal risks of automated contracts and how the risk is managed
• Manage the key stakeholders involved in the smart contracting process
• Understand the advantages of smart contracts in the reduction of the need for legal instructions and human intervention
• Formulate strategies allowing for the co-existence of legal and smart contracts in a single transaction
• Understand what Cryptocurrencies are and how they work
• Understand what ICOs are and how they work
title: Graduate Certificate in Law and Technology Module 5: Blockchain, Cryptocurrencies and Smart Contracts

areaOfTrainings.description: Human Resource Management, Employment and Recruitment

content:
This micro-credential in Applied Human Resource Technologies & Digitalisation is tailored for Human Resource (HR) professionals who are keen to enhance their skill set and remain competitive in an ever-evolving industry. It equips HR professionals with the skills and knowledge to leverage cutting-edge HR technologies and digital solutions, transforming HR operations and strategic decision-making. 

This micro-credential is a collaborative offering by Singapore Polytechnic, School of Business in partnership with the Institute for Human Resource Professionals (IHRP). This program empowers HR professionals with the skills and knowledge to leverage technologies in the field of Human Resources, enhancing efficiency, accuracy, and strategic decision-making. By completing this micro-credential, learners also have the exclusive opportunity to apply for an IHRP Skills Badge, further validating their competency and professional growth. 

This Micro-Credential course is a 5-week part-time course with lessons conducted in a blended learning mode, including synchronised online lessons (in the evening), self-directed e-Learning, and face-to-face assessment.
objective: ​​The course is designed to provide participants with the working knowledge of some of the leading Human Resource (HR) technologies and tools to improve HR efficiency and effectiveness across the various HR functions. Participants will be able to implement and manage Human Resource Management Systems (HRMS), as well as apply new technologies in Human Resources.​
title: (Micro-Credential) Applied Human Resource (HR) Technologies and Digitalisation (Synchronous and Asynchronous e-learning)
